jobDescription: About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary This individual will be responsible for data entry of invoices and accruals. Additionally, the person will perform daily accounting functions which includes payment runs in the Accounts Payable ERP system. Duties And Responsibilities Manage relationships with employees/vendors to ensure AP gives first-rate customer service Assist with month-end close: complete journal entries for accrual purposes Have a basic understanding of accounting to ensure proper coding of invoices Complete invoice entry with accuracy for tax purposes and audits Respond to day-to-day payment inquiries from department managers and vendors Assist with implementation of ERP projects which includes testing of system changes Assists with audits, internal and externally Other projects and ad-hoc reporting as needed. Essential Skills Self-motivated, pro-active, organized, and able to work within a team and independently Able to exercise independent discretion on matters of significance Must have the ability to listen, communicate effectively (both orally and in writing) and to interact with all levels within the organization Able to maintain a positive attitude and work in a fast paced/growing company Strong knowledge in accounting software and Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel; and have ability to quickly learn systems. Preferred Qualifications Experience with Oracle or similar ERP a plus. Experience with invoice workflow automation a plus. Travel Required Up to 25% Functional Description Checks and verifies cost accounting, account payable records, prepares invoices and vouchers, types, files, posts ledger and general journal entries, and/or balances accounts payable and accounts receivable records. Uses office automated systems to input data, generate reports, conduct specialized research projects and respond to inquiries. May reconcile difficult accounts. May maintain a complete and systematic set of transactions in a specific phase of accounting. Functional/Business Knowledge Complete understanding of the aspects of the job. Applies high level of knowledge to complete a wide range of tasks that normally requires time management skills. Scope Work at this level requires following established practices. May independently plan own work, referring only unusual cases to supervisor. Frequent contact with employees at all levels within the company. Understands implications of work and makes recommendations for solutions. Judgement Assignments are complex in nature where judgment and initiative is required in resolving problems and making recommendations. Thoroughness and reliability are essential as errors would result in a possibility for loss and normally affect other groups. Management N/A Field Sales N/A Experience And Education Typically requires a minimum of 6-8 years of related experience and High School diploma/certificate or equivalent. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Dexcom Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com . An Equal Opportunity Employer . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary Assists with maintaining daily operations by performing administrative duties and office reception. Duties may include fielding telephone calls, receiving and directing visitors, word processing, data entry, filing, faxing and supply inventory management. Extensive data entry skills are required, as well as Internet research abilities and strong communication skills. Duties And Responsibilities Open, sort, document and distribute incoming correspondence, including faxes and email. Retrieve via web portals sensitive product and customer information Oversee all aspects of general office coordination. Maintain office calendar to coordinate work flow and meetings. Maintain confidentiality in all aspects of client, staff and agency information. Interact with clients, vendors and visitors. Answer telephones and transfer to appropriate staff member. Prepare responses to correspondence containing routine inquiries. Perform general clerical duties. Electronically file and retrieve product support documents, records and reports. Coordinate and maintain records for staff, office space, telephones. Coordinate travel Create and modify documents using word processing, spreadsheet, database and/or other presentation software such as Microsoft Office or other programs. May conduct research, compile data and prepare papers for consideration and presentation. Set up and coordinate meetings and conferences. Collect and maintain inventory of office equipment and supplies. Support staff in assigned project‐based work. This position assumes and performs other duties and assignments as required by department. Functional Description Provides administrative and clerical support to relieve department managers or staff of administrative details. May coordinate messages, appointments, information to callers, file maintenance, department office supplies and mail. Researches, compiles and proofs word processing assignments. Operates automated office equipment. May be assigned to various functional areas of the company. Functional/Business Knowledge Has obtained a broad understanding and knowledge of the job to perform a wide-range of tasks. Applies job skills and company policies and procedures to complete a variety of tasks. Scope Job requires the performance of work in accordance with standard practice, which enables the employee to proceed with reference of only questionable cases to the supervisor. Assignments are moderately complex in nature where ability to recognize deviation from accepted practice is required. Information exchanged may require diplomacy and tact. Judgement Normally receives little instruction on daily work, general instructions on newly introduced assignments. Nature of decisions demands a consistent accuracy as errors may cause some serious delay, waste of materials or loss of time due to rework or checking revised output. Experience And Education Typically requires a minimum of 4-6 years of related experience and High School diploma/certificate or equivalent. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported expected full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Summary Highly skilled Analytical Scientist with expert level experience in analytical method develop, method validation, specification development, analytical instrumentation maintenance, repair and troubleshooting and timely problem solving. In particular: Extractables and Leachables (E&L) experience and polymer experience are sought after. Someone who is proactive in driving innovation, works well independently and understands the importance and strength of the team. Knowledge and awareness to medical product life cycle and applicable rules and regulations is a plus. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Design, develop and validate analytical test methods: the buildout of Analytical Services at Dexcom. This position will require the writing of protocols and validation implementation using Dexcom QMS systems. The position is hands-on with a high level of chromatography expertise: HPLC, GC (Agilent) and GPC (Malvern) needed Ideally someone with mass spectrometry experience, in particular HPLC-QToF Understands polymer characterization and can run MDSC, TGA, TMA, Rheometers, Viscometers and Instron LIMs experience and comfort in looking at databases and trending data Lead the ideation, experiment design, execution, interpretation, and drive for scientific conclusion and decision to meet the targeted project goals and business objectives Work with cross-functional teams to solicit input and feedback as well as providing advice on raw material supply, biocompatibility, safety, scalability and other operation related design inputs and consultation. Estimates work schedule, communicates progress and issues to management Follows team standards and mentoring of junior staff Required Qualifications Related experience in R&D or manufacturing with an emphasis on the biotech or medical device industry Must be knowledgeable of analytical techniques, polymer structure-properties relationship, synthesis and analytical instrumentation Must be familiar with instrument troubleshooting and repair, Mass spectrometry understanding needed: MS n and fragmentation Ideally expertise in Chromatography: HPLC and GPC’s: Agilent systems and Malvern Omisolv. Able to run sequences and process data. Education Requirements Bachelor’s Degree is required, degree in Analytical Chemistry is preferred with a Material Science or Polymer Chemistry degree a plus Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 5-8 years related experience or Masters degree and 2-5 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 0-2 years experience. Functional Description Provides technical expertise to the design and development of new invasive and noninvasive medical device product(s). Investigates/evaluates existing technology and advises research and development, regulatory affairs, and reliability engineering to ensure appropriate process development under the best possible conditions. Designs and implements new methodologies, materials, machines, processes, or products. Develops new concepts from initial design to market release. Conducts feasibility studies of the design to determine ability to function as intended. Maintains detailed documentation throughout all phases of research and development. Coordinates activities with outside suppliers and consultants to ensure the delivery of supplies or services needed to meet scheduled timelines. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses broad understanding of technical principles and theories. Ability to synthesize external data and research findings for application that may impact technical objectives. Scope Demonstrates successes in technical proficiency and independent thought. Works on complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Exercises judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Judgement Exercises good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments.

About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Functional Description: Support Individual Contributor Performs functions associated with calibration, including working with engineers in set-up and calibration tasks. Uses sophisticated programs to collect and evaluate data. Assist in developing methods and procedures for calibration. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Responsible for performing a variety of work functions related to equipment calibration and maintenance of the equipment calibration system. Incumbent may develop written calibration procedures, schedule calibration activities (internal and external), perform equipment calibration and adjustments, ensure proper documentation of calibrations results, and maintain the equipment calibration system. Must be proficient with calibration methodologies, troubleshooting, and adjustments. Support and assist with out-of-tolerance equipment investigations, as necessary. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to execute each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Calibrate equipment such as scales/balances, thermometers, temperature & humidity chambers, dimensional equipment, mass, force, dewpoint, pressure/vacuum, time, velocity, ovens, refrigerators/freezers, differential pressure, etc. Review documentation for accuracy and compliance. Generate reports, records, update histories, and perform data entry in the equipment control system. Calibrate, troubleshoot, and adjust measuring equipment Maintain calibration test equipment, work area, and lab Work with relevant industry guidelines, e.g., ISO-13485, ISO-17025, ISO-10012, CFR 820 Use the Microsoft Suite of products: Word, Excel, Outlook, Lucid Charts, etc. Utilize calibration software, e.g., Fluke Metcal, Meteams, National Instrument Calibration Executive suite, SureCal, Vaisala, etc. Follow related SOPs, cGMPs, and industry practices Work in a cleanroom environment Work in an EPA (ESD) controlled environment. Required Qualifications Experience in Calibrating equipment such as scales/balances, thermometers, temperature & humidity chambers, dimensional equipment, mass, force, dewpoint, pressure/vacuum, time, velocity, ovens, refrigerators/freezers, differential pressure, etc. Review documentation for accuracy and compliance. Generate reports, records, update histories, and perform data entry in the equipment control system. Calibrate, troubleshoot, and adjust measuring equipment Maintain calibration test equipment, work area, and lab Work with relevant industry guidelines, e.g., ISO-13485, ISO-17025, ISO-10012, CFR 820 Use the Microsoft Suite of products: Word, Excel, Outlook, Lucid Charts, etc. Utilize calibration software, e.g., Fluke Metcal, Meteams, National Instrument Calibration Executive suite, SureCal, Vaisala, etc. Follow related SOPs, cGMPs, and industry practices Work in a cleanroom environment Work in an EPA (ESD) controlled environment. Preferred Qualifications Previous work experience in an FDA or regulated industry Experience working with GMP practices Calibration Technician Certification (CCT) and/or industry Technical Certification is preferred. Calibration database management and navigation experience, Blue Mountain (RAM) Software is preferred. Knowledge of ESD principles Experience And Education Requirements High School diploma/certificate or equivalent. Typically requires a minimum of 3-5 years of related experience Language Skills Must be able to communicate effectively in English. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Functional Description Performs functions associated with quality control and quality assurance operations, including working with engineers in set-up and calibration tasks and carrying out rework and quality assurance procedures related to production or operations. Uses sophisticated programs to collect and evaluate data to assist in assessing and documenting results of quality assurance and control processes. Determines and may assist in developing methods and procedures for quality assurance and control. Works with engineers in conducting experiments. Functional/Business Knowledge Moderate understanding of general job aspects and some understanding of the detailed aspects of the job. Applies acquired job and company knowledge of policies and procedures to complete semi-routine tasks. Scope Work at this level requires following standardized methods and under immediate supervision on assignments that are semi-routine in nature. Follows pre-established guidelines and procedures with minimal choice as to method of performance of the work. Has contact with employees at other levels within the company. Information exchanged is generally non-complex. Judgement Normally follows established procedures on routine work, requires instructions only on new assignments. Works under close supervision. Management N/A Field Sales N/A Experience And Education Typically requires a minimum of 2-4 years of related experience and a High School diploma/certificate or equivalent. jobTitle: Clinical Document and Trial Master File (TMF) Specialist
jobDescription: About Dexcom Dexcom, Inc. empowers people to take control of diabetes through innovative continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems. Headquartered in San Diego, California, Dexcom has emerged as a leader of diabetes care technology. By listening to the needs of users, caregivers, and providers, Dexcom simplifies and improves diabetes management around the world. Summary The Clinical Document and Trial Master File (TMF/eTMF) Specialist will report to Stayce Beck and is responsible for managing the lifecycle of TMF activities for all ongoing and new Dexcom clinical trials and associated applicable documentation. Responsibilities also include TMF process development and implementation in accordance with applicable regulatory requirements, Dexcom internal Standard Operating Procedures and Clinical Procedures and the study-specific TMF plans, as well as supporting the clinical project teams to ensure TMF quality, per ICH E6 (R2) guidelines for regulatory inspection readiness. The Trial Master File Specialist will be responsible for the set-up, maintenance, monitoring completeness, quality control metrics and TMF closeout activities. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Set-up and indexing (standardizing file structures and nomenclature) of TMF/eTMF Provide support for electronic submissions of regulatory registries and institutional review board/ethics committee (IRB/IEC) submissions Provide support and management of any regulatory or IRB/IEB submissions Provide support for electronic submissions of documentation to Oracle Cloud Application/Agile Application Provide support for review and quality check of any regulatory or IRB/IEC submissions Filing study documents onto the TMF in accordance with Standard Operating Procedures/Clinical Procedures Provides training and on-boarding to study teams into the specific TMF or eTMF processes in order to build knowledge and awareness of good, quality documentation management practices for clinical trials Maintains the lifecycle TMF activities from initiation to close-out Acts as the primary contact and point of escalation for project specific TMF issues. Communicating and collaborating with Dexcom internal and external teams (Sponsors, Study Initiators, TMF vendor(s)/eTMF vendors to ensure completeness and quality of filed clinical trial documents Reviews TMF documentation prior to filing in the TMF and if issues and/or discrepancies are identified with TMF content, remediates directly with the Clinical Affairs functional teams. Upon resolution of identified findings, the TMF Specialist appropriately tracks resolution/closure via tracking mechanisms and uploads to the TMF. Will works cross-functionally to resolve document or TMF related issues Represents Clinical Operational Compliance at study team meetings, participate in collaborative efforts and plays an important cross-functional role in TMF document retrieval and management Provides regular status reporting on the TMF quality, completeness, and audit readiness while identifying and mitigating GDP potential risks In preparation for study TMF closure, perform a close out review of study TMF and remediate findings with Study Lead or designee and/or external vendors Ensure the TMF is inspection ready at all times and trial master file documents are filed contemporaneously in a timely manner, in accordance with metrics timelines Assists with internal as well as external TMF audits Provide support to Clinical Operational Compliance during audits and/or regulatory inspections Prepares the TMF records for transfer, long-term on-site or off-site archival Required Qualifications Possesses strong computer skills, including proficiency with Word, Excel, Access, Outlook, and/or PowerPoint, or ability to quickly learn applicable software programs. Demonstrated experience working with TMF and eTMF technologies and/or Document Management applications Demonstrated experience working with eRegulatory Systems (e.g., Veeva Vault, etc.) Thorough knowledge of ALCOA FDA standards, Good Clinical Practice, and Good Documentation Practice, per ICH (E6 (R2), FDA guidelines, ISO14155, and applicability to all stages of the clinical development process Knowledge of TMF Reference Model, clinical trial activities and related terminology. Must have knowledge of Project and Site level files and corresponding expected documents per level Preferred Qualifications Experience with clinical trials in the therapeutic area of Diabetes Current GCP (Good Clinical Practice) Training Document management Experience with Clinical Trial Management System (CTMS) and Electronic Data Capture Systems (EDC) Prior experience supporting internal audits and/or Regulatory Authority inspections Travel Required None Experience And Education Requirements Bachelor’s Degree or an equivalent combination of education, training, and relevant experience required At least two (2) years of TMF experience required, including experience in study start-up, maintenance, and closeout activities. Functional Description Performs the coordination and preparation of internal and external audits and compliance in accordance with regulatory standards. Collaborates with clients to develop positive and proactive approaches to regulatory compliance. Participates in good laboratory practices training of functional areas and assists in the development of training sessions. Ensures that privacy and security standards are met and adhered to. May coordinate activities and assist with interactions during regulatory agency inspections. May direct interaction with regulatory agencies on defined matters. Recommends strategies for earliest possible approvals of clinical trials applications. Assists with the corrective action implementation. May coordinate investigator site and clinical supplier vendor audits. Functional/Business Knowledge Learns to use professional concepts and skills. Frequent use and general knowledge of industry practices, techniques, and standards. General application of concepts, and principles. Learns to use professional concepts and skills. Applies company policies and procedures to resolve routine issues. Scope Works on problems of limited scope and complexity. Works under only general supervision. Work is reviewed for soundness of judgment and overall accuracy. Receives general oversight and guidance on approaches for project related tasks. Builds stable working relationships internally. Judgement Follows standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained. Normally receives detailed instructions on all work and work output it closely supervised. Management N/A Field Sales N/A Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree and 0-2 years previous experience. Workplace Type The Workplace Type for this role is High Flex. Based on the nature of your position you will be working onsite approximately 1 day per week from collaborative space and hoteling desks at our Dexcom sites. You will need to be located within commuting distance (typically 75 miles/120km) of your assigned Dexcom site. An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com . About Dexcom Dexcom, Inc. empowers people to take control of diabetes through innovative continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems. Headquartered in San Diego, California, Dexcom has emerged as a leader of diabetes care technology. By listening to the needs of users, caregivers, and providers, Dexcom simplifies and improves diabetes management around the world. Position Summary Implement and monitor clinical studies at participating study sites according to Good Clinical Practices (GCP), ICH Guidelines and the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR). Works with other CRAs, Manager and/or Executive Director of Clinical Affairs to effectively plan and execute DexCom-sponsored clinical studies (including In-House studies), and/or DexCom supported external studies (Investigator-initiated, industry-sponsored, etc.). Responsible for conducting site visits, monitoring, and performing all ancillary requirements in executing clinical studies to ensure proper data collection and write-up for documentation or submission of clinical study data. Provides preliminary input to project teams and helps train/mentor entry-level CRAs. Duties And Responsibilities Include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Designs, plans, conducts and monitors Dexcom-sponsored clinical studies with minimal supervision. Able to act as a study and/or site lead for multiple sites/projects simultaneously and understands clinical study management/prioritization. Works independently to provide clinical and logistical support for externally-sponsored studies (investigator-initiated, industry-sponsored, etc.) and program maintenance Assesses clinical investigators, study staff, and contract research organizations (if applicable) for compliance with study protocols, regulations, and DexCom Standard Operating Procedures. Implements appropriate corrective action as needed Writes clinical study reports for inclusion in regulatory submissions and helps develop clinical study materials (including, but not limited to, source documentation, CRFs, IRB submissions, training slides, etc.) with minimal assistance Assist with the preparation of monthly financial reports Ensuring and processing accurate and timely invoicing and accruals Attend finance department and company-wide meetings, sometimes assisting with financial reporting to managers and senior executives Works on multiple projects and routinely suggests process improvements Effectively works independently and to support project team on both routine and non-routine department tasks Interacts effectively with peers and leadership across departments and can interface professionally with outside investigators, IRBs, FDA, and companies Elevates concerns or problems to management team and promotes day-to-day harmony within the department Supports an environment of changing priorities Essential Skills To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily and have demonstrated mastery of entry-level tasks and expectations. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be able to work independently and collaborate with clinical research team. Preferred Qualifications Advanced MS Excel skills (creating spreadsheets and using financial functions) Organizational and time-management skills Attention to detail, with an ability to spot numerical errors Travel Required 30% - Traveling up to 30% of the time can be expected. The employee may be requested to travel on extended-length trips, overseas travel, and nights/weekends as needed. Functional Description Collaborates with various departments on the design, documentation, testing and implementation of clinical data studies. Develops systems for organizing data to analyze, identify and report trends. Analyzes the interrelationships of data and defines logical aspects of data sets. Prepares reports of clinical trial studies for internal validation and cross validation studies. May evaluate and resolve issues regarding contents of reports. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses a high level of theoretical knowledge. Ability to deliver technical ideas that have an impact on the objectives. Understands organizational and functional processes and policies aligned to the technical and business goals. Scope Demonstrates technical proficiency. Works on moderately complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation. Exercises judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Interprets data and draws conclusions regarding results used in presented material. Judgement Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Normally receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 2-5 years related experience or Masters degree and 0-2 years equivalent experience. Degree in a Science or Health-related field; nursing or diabetes experience desirable, but not mandatory. Previous GCP training is required. 3yrs CRA experience desired (or an equivalent combination of education, professional training, experience, or demonstrated merit that provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities in clinical research). Has demonstrated proficiency and mastery of CRA I level tasks and is capable of planning/executing all logistics for a clinical study and of working independently as a study lead. Professional certification (e.g. ACRP, SoCRA) considered a plus. An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Functional Description Acts as primary notification and consolidation point for receiving, processing, analyzing and reporting product complaints. Develops and updates company complaint and inspection procedures to ensure capture and investigation of complaints. Maintains and analyzes problem logs to identify and report recurring issues to quality assurance management and product development. Documents and tracks contact information, reported issues and problems in accordance with company guidelines and external regulatory requirements. May collaborate with other internal groups to respond to product inquiries and issues. May directly answer telephone “hot line” and written or Internet-based inquiries regarding company products. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Demonstrates a primary commitment to patient safety and product quality by maintaining compliance to the Quality Policy and all other documented quality processes and procedures Ability to work in an environment with multiple short-term deadlines, frequent interruptions and changing priorities. Review and evaluate complaints per Standard Operating Procedures. Analyze adverse incident factors under supervision. May assist determining if events must be reported to Regulatory Authorities Document and maintain records of all complaint investigations in accordance with domestic and worldwide international regulations (e.g. 820, MDD, ISO, and other countries). Complete all required customer complaint related documentation in an accurate, professional and timely manner. Contribute high quality work. Contribute to the development and implementation of procedures that ensure quality standards are met. Support projects that further the improvement and efficiency of the department Support internal, external, and third-party audits. Perform routine complaint system data entry, documentation, and administrative tasks. Able to work flexible hours, including evenings, holidays and weekends. Overtime may be required. Perform other duties as assigned Required Qualifications 0 to 2 years related experience preferably in medical device post-market product surveillance complaint handling or equivalent combination of education and experience. Strong analytic ability is required. Basic computer software skills, i.e. Microsoft Office. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of and experience in field of diabetes and CGM technology is highly desirable. Certification(s) for particular engineering/quality discipline. Intermediate computer software skills, e.g. MS Excel and MS PowerPoint. Experience/Education Typically requires 0-2 years of related experience and a High school diploma/certificate or equivalent. Functional Description Acts as the consolidation point for receiving, processing, and analyzing customer complaint records. Responsible for the uniformed and timely quality review of product complaint records including the completion of a regulatory reporting assessment and potential submission of a medical device report. Reviews allegations of potential product problems in accordance with company guidelines and external regulatory requirements. Ensures complaints are evaluated to determine whether the allegation represents an event which is required to be reported to the applicable regulatory agency. Responsible for reviewing the investigations associated to both hardware and/or software issues when applicable. Determines if complaint information is accurate, logical and complete or if additional information/follow-up is required. Functional/Business Knowledge Basic understanding of general job aspects and limited understanding of the detailed aspects of the job. Acquires job skills and learns the policies and procedures required to complete routine tasks. Scope Work at this level requires following standardized, routine methods, under immediate supervision. Assignments are routine in nature and expectation is to follow pre-established guidelines and procedures. Contacts are mostly within own team and immediate supervisor. Judgement Little responsibility for decisions as to method or selection of work. Receives detailed instructions on routine work and new assignments. Works under close supervision. Management N/A Field Sales N/A Experience And Education Typically requires 0-2 years of related experience and a High school diploma/certificate or equivalent. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Dexcom Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com . An Equal Opportunity Employer . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Position Summary Dexcom is a high-growth, fast-paced environment where you work with leading-edge, software teams to ensure the security of modern diabetes medical device systems. We’re seeking Penetration Testers whose job duties would include, but are not limited to, performing internal/external network-based penetration tests, software/firmware/application testing, breach simulation, and wireless protocol testing. The ideal candidate should have a combination of experience and/or certifications. Experience should be identified by previous job duties, published work, or public presentations. You will work alongside highly skilled and passionate cybersecurity professionals who know how to deliver exceptional results while also having some fun along the way. For this role, you would be joining Dexcom’s Research and Development Cybersecurity team to design and implement new applications and features for Dexcom’s medical device platforms. As a member of the R&D Cybersecurity team, you will be responsible for reviewing new and existing technologies, identifying, and ranking potential risks, providing remediation/mitigation suggestions and direction, as well as documenting your findings for review. Additionally, you will be responsible for working with the various development teams and product managers to ensure that new projects are properly secured.  Duties And Responsibilities Internal/external network-based penetration tests Software/firmware/application testing Low-level hardware attacks including fault-injection & side-channel attacks High-Level hardware attacks such as identification & analysis of serial communications Bare-metal firmware reverse engineering Mobile application (iOS/Android) high-level penetration testing Web API & UI black box penetration testing Wireless protocol testing (Bluetooth & NFC) Participate in security requirements and design reviews Review security requirements and design specifications. Create testing plans, procedures, and risk analyses Test the configuration, functionality, and user interface of applications and tools Develop, utilize, and maintain automated and manual test scripts to test mobile device security. Document technical issues identified during security testing and write reports. Analyze vulnerabilities and security gaps then collaborate with development teams to ensure issues are resolved Follow internal software development, cybersecurity, and validation procedures that comply with medical and security regulations. Modify test protocols based on requirement changes Advise DevOps team members on security best-practices Essential Skills 2+ years of experience in a pen-testing specific role Information Security Fundamentals - 3 years of experience or BS degree (or higher) in a technical discipline Experienced in vulnerability assessment and penetration testing methodologies Strong understanding of practical and theoretical hardware attacks Experience with Fuzzing Tools An understanding of Static and Dynamic Code Analysis (SAST/DAST) An understanding of mobile application penetration testing Experience with Web API & UI penetration testing from both white box & black box perspectives An understanding of implementing offensive tests against wireless communication protocols such as Bluetooth and NFC in IoT systems An understanding of various forms of network architecture Experience with using a security-based risk scoring system (CVSS) Knowledge of OWASP top ten vulnerabilities for web applications and APIs Experience with a common scripting language (Python, Bash) At least 1 or more certifications such as OSCP, OSEP, GCPN, GPEN, GXPN, or comparable are required Preferred Qualifications: (Optional, otherwise delete section) 2-5 years’ Experience working in Google Cloud Services Platform (GCP) 2-5 years’ Experience working in a Mobile Environment (Android, iOS) Security Testing Certifications such as OSWE, GWAP, GMOB, eMAPT, eCXD, OSMR CRTO, CISSP, CCSP, or Burp Suite Certified Practitioner Professional Security Certifications: CISSP, CCSP, CISA, CISM, ITIL Cloud Computing certifications such as CCSK, AWS, Azure, and GCP Experience with threat modeling and hazard-analysis frameworks such as STAMP, STRIDE, etc. Experience in Red Teaming engagements Familiar with multiple scripting or programming languages such as C, Java, Ruby, Perl, Python, and PowerShell Ability to create custom hardware attacks tools for unique situations where there are limited commercial options Experience leveraging the MITRE ATT&CK™ Framework Previous Web Application development experience Strong knowledge of industry standards as they relate to Cloud and Application security management including ISO, NIST, and Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) Exposure to agile development, DevOps, SecOps, and scrum teams Experience in the Medical device industry and HIPAA regulations Functional Description Performs security assessments of company products that may include vulnerability and risk assessments, threat analysis, and security code reviews to identify potential design and implementation vulnerabilities. Designs and develops security features for products including systems, applications and/or solutions. Integrates new security features and updates into existing products and ensures the security of all products is maintained throughout the product lifecycle. Provides product security engineering recommendations and resolves integration and testing issues. Builds a standardized set of security product requirements and produces metrics to report performance against those requirements. Reviews and defines security diagnostics and tools to facilitate the analysis and reporting of security events. Detects and mitigates security risks, responds to product security incidents, and works with customers regarding product security related issues. Leads or participates in security architecture and design review meetings. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses a high level of theoretical knowledge. Ability to deliver technical ideas that have an impact on the objectives. Understands organizational and functional processes and policies aligned to the technical and business goals. Scope Demonstrates technical proficiency. Works on moderately complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation. Exercises judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Interprets data and draws conclusions regarding results used in presented material. Judgement Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. Normally receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 2-5 years related experience or Masters degree and 0-2 years equivalent experience.

About Dexcom Dexcom, Inc. empowers people to take control of diabetes through innovative continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) systems. Headquartered in San Diego, California, Dexcom has emerged as a leader of diabetes care technology. By listening to the needs of users, caregivers, and providers, Dexcom simplifies and improves diabetes management around the world. Position Summary The Director, Clinical Data Management is responsible for the operational and strategic aspects of clinical data management and programming and reports directly to the Senior Director, Biometrics. This role oversees the planning, design, documentation, testing, and implementation of data systems ensuring a high level of data quality aligning with statistical analysis requirements and regulatory standards to support approval and commercialization of Dexcom’s medical devices. Leads teams collecting clinical evidence across multiple concurrent internal and external studies of varying size and complexity. This role works in close collaboration with the clinical study team, biostatistics, R&D, regulatory, and quality, with the ability to effectively influence directly and diplomatically to ensure data quality standards are met. Responsible for ensuring the overall data management strategy supports clinical development and company objectives. Develops policies and procedures to support clinical infrastructure. Manages both resources and budget and develops dashboards and study metrics to facilitate data governance, quality, and analysis. Ensures Dexcom sponsored clinical studies are executed in accordance with FDA regulations, GCP, and GDMP. This position requires a proven track record of successful design, planning, and execution of multiple ongoing medium-to-large scale clinical studies, including creative planning and resourcing, and the ability to develop contingencies and handle ambiguity. This role will build highly performing teams including managing, mentoring, and motivating employees. Duties And Responsibilities Provides leadership, direction, and oversight to the data managers and statistical programmers. Responsible for ensuring the data management deliverables and activities meet project timelines aligned with company objectives. Leads the planning, design, documentation, testing, and implementation of data systems to generate evidence from clinical studies aligning with regulatory standards. Develops, revises, and enforces standards and procedures to facilitate efficient and accurate data collection and reporting of metrics and trends. Provides early strategic input into protocol design and data collection methods focused on data management issues. Responsible for and oversees development of annotated CRFs, database documentation, edit check specifications, data handling conventions and data entry instructions. Oversees CRO and vendor activities to ensure data management deliverables and activities are met. Serves as a subject matter expert providing strategic input across the clinical organization. Partners and effectively collaborate cross-functionally across Clinical Affairs, R&D, regulatory, quality, New Markets, and Medical Affairs. Detailed knowledge of medical device development process including working knowledge of ICH, GCP, GDP, and FDA regulations. Essential Skills Must have extensive experience with electronic data capture systems and SAS. Must have an analytical mind, ability to influence and collaborate both with co-workers, and excellent listening and interpersonal skills. Functional Description Directs the design, documentation, testing and implementation of clinical data collection studies, and clinical database review. Collaborates and coordinates with others to design and implement clinical protocols and data collection systems. Develops systems for organizing data to analyze, identify and report data and trends. Manages data management issues by reviewing protocols for cross-project consistency and identifying standard case report form modules to meet objectives. Develops data quality plans. Provides early strategic input into protocol design focused on data management issues. Reviews and resolves data discrepancies for standardized data validation systems and procedures. May also be responsible for projects that have been contracted with contract research organizations, as well as internal projects. Selects, develops and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Functional/Business Knowledge Viewed as a subject matter expert within specific area. Reviews objectives to determine success of operation. Involved in developing, modifying and executing company policies that affect immediate operations and may also have company-wide effect. Understands relevant business strategies and impact on the functional area. Scope Participates in establishing strategic plans and objectives. Provides high-level guidance and support to employees and other managers. Regularly interacts with executives and/or external parties on matters effecting the function. Oversees policies and procedures for immediate function. Recognized as a functional leader within the organization. Judgement Works on abstract issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth knowledge of the company. Participates in corporate development of methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for projects, programs, and people. Erroneous decisions will have a serious impact on the overall success of functional or company operations. Management Able to operate in complex global environment. Manages the activities of a functional area and/or external service providers. People management responsibilities include hiring / terminations, performance reviews, career development coaching and compensation decisions. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree with 15+ years of industry experience. 9+ years of successful management experience in relevant industry. An Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Talent Acquisition at talentacquisition@dexcom.com . About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported expected full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Position Summary Recently formed, the Hospital Business Unit (HBU) is focused on developing compelling go-to-market strategies, inclusive of targeted value propositions with the necessary supporting evidence that will resonate with the hospital ecosystem of stakeholders important to the adoption of real time continuous glucose monitoring (RT-CGM) in the inpatient setting. The HBU is a new organization within Dexcom and therefore, leadership must be able to navigate leveraging/aligning cross functional partners while simultaneously, proposing and driving new initiatives in a highly entrepreneurial environment. The vast majority of the HBU will be accessed via a matrix structure so building relationships and establishing operating principles with other functional groups is essential. This role will be responsible for developing the go-to-market strategies for launching the HBU, inclusive of pricing, segmentation and targeting, forecasting, salesforce strategy, KPIs, product positioning, messaging and claims. This senior role, reporting to the Vice-President, General Manager of the HBU, is responsible for developing the near term market launch for the HBU. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Develops and executes marketing strategies and programs to achieve commercialization, profitability, business growth and market share objectives. Develop HBU’s initial go-to-market strategies inclusive of pricing, segmentation and targeting, positioning, messaging and claims. Develop specific cadence of product launch activities, clear go/no go criteria and investment rationale. In collaboration with core Marketing team, develop professional education, web presence and social media strategies, as well as key literature and supporting materials. Lead the management of project-specific timelines and budgets to meet and exceed corporate objectives. In collaboration with Dexcom core marketing team, determine agencies and suppliers of record, and negotiate contract terms and conditions for major services. Develop KoL relationships to support commercial objectives. Makes data-driven decisions, review market research and trends to anticipate and react to competition and customer reactions, and initiate / recommend new research proposals as needed. Provide leadership to professional staff. Ensure employees are positioned for success by providing guidance and championing performance and development opportunities. Manage, coach, and mentor team members. Provide specific, timely, and constructive performance feedback. Collaborate closely with Dexcom brand marketing team and guidelines. Other duties as assigned. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported expected full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Position Summary This position is within R&D organization. The Director of Product Verification and Validation is a key leadership position, in this position individual will work with the V&V team to develop and grow individuals for next stage in their career. This individual will evaluate overall product testing strategy starting from early development phases till final V&V, by working cross functionally this individual will define optimal testing strategy which is aligned with best engineering practices and FDA/ISO guidelines. The V&V leader is fully empowered to drive efficiency within V&V organization either through automation or other means to ensure highest level of quality products are released. The leader of V&V team will lead and develop the design of fixturing and validate test methods to ensure they reflect use conditions, are repeatable, and reproduceable. The individual will guide and mentor team of test engineers, define testing strategies, and results analysis of electromechanical and electrochemical designs, instruments, subassemblies, firmware, and electrical at system level assemblies for new and existing products. The portfolio focuses on high volume and low-cost wearable and receiver devices which includes bio-chemical sensor, electronics, mechanics, algorithms, and firmware. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Overall Leadership Coordinates and communicates, builds trusts with V&V and other cross-functional team members on product roadmap, feature sets, and partnership opportunities that lead to reliable and consistent product performance. Lead and inspire high preforming test engineering team with system/platform thinking as a focus Ensures department budgets, schedules, and performance requirements are met. Oversees delivery of engineering projects while supporting a unified culture, vision, and strategy for the R&D team. Strong focus on engineering excellence, execution and craftmanship as a customer champion Build, coach and manage a strong team of engineers and engineering managers who set the standard and up-level the overall talent of organization. Anticipates and aggressively remove roadblocks/obstacles that slow down or prevent products and programs from delivering on their objectives Define, measure, and communicate key metrics to assess the overall effectiveness of the test engineering team. Develop and conduct design verification test plans/reports in compliance with FDA/ISO and international guidelines. Facilitates the research, planning, designing, verification, validation, and development of mechanical and/or electromechanical product tests and systems. Lead the design, development, and test of both manual and automated test systems for testing medical devices Research and implement state of the art technologies to enhance test equipment features, improve safety, reliability, and performance; thereby optimizing manufacturing throughput and lowering manufacturing costs Required Qualifications Minimum 8-10+ years of leading product verification and validation teams in complex electromechanical systems. Comfortable leading and motivating highly talented teams ensuring that modern technology and process are implemented. You should be experienced in working with and presenting to senior management leadership. Good people and line management skills and the ability to recruit and develop a high performing team. Results-oriented, self-disciplined, fast-paced, motivated individual that requires minimal supervision and able to multitask several projects at one time Strong Communication (oral/written) to included strong presentation skills, including ability to communicate in small and large settings and at all levels in the organization, including senior level management Demonstrated ability to process complex information and summarize it concisely in writing and/or verbally in a professional manner Ability to work in a deadline-driven and fast-paced environment including managing multiple projects Ability to effectively prioritize and communicate those prioritize to the team Ability to lead people, teams and projects to deliver comprehensive testing and automation across software products in multiple sites and geographies. Preferred Qualifications Test engineering leadership experience in regulated environments such as medical device engineering. Proven track record of commercially released electro-mechanical consumer and/or medical products Experience developing products requiring clinical validations and regulatory compliance Experience developing products and processes for large scale (multi-million per year) production Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree with 15+ years of industry experience. 9+ years of successful management experience in relevant industry. Functional Description Responsible for directing and collaborating with various functional teams throughout the R&D, quality, and regulatory organizations. Ensures all verification and validation testing complies per regulatory body guidelines. Prepares and presents reports outlining the outcome of verification and validation testing. Functional/Business Knowledge Viewed as a subject matter expert within specific area. Reviews objectives to determine success of operation. Involved in developing, modifying and executing company policies that affect immediate operations and may also have company-wide effect. Understands relevant business strategies and impact on the functional area. Scope Participates in establishing strategic plans and objectives. Provides high-level guidance and support to employees and other managers. Regularly interacts with executives and/or external parties on matters effecting the function. Oversees policies and procedures for immediate function. Recognized as a functional leader within the organization. Judgement Works on abstract issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth knowledge of the company. Participates in corporate development of methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for projects, programs, and people. Erroneous decisions will have a serious impact on the overall success of functional or company operations. Management Able to operate in complex global environment. Manages the activities of a functional area and/or external service providers. People management responsibilities include hiring / terminations, performance reviews, career development coaching and compensation decisions.

About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary As part of the Design Verification Team, you will apply your high standards in the accurate and consistent execution of test activities to complement a team of skilled technicians and engineers dedicated to the successful launch of our next generation of Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems. In accordance with our internal procedures, you will independently prepare test specimens, prepare consumables, set up fixtures, execute tests, measure, and collect test data. You will record data and document test results using good documentation practices. If test deviations or failures are observed, your clear and concise failure analysis documentation will enable root cause investigations in collaboration with our test engineers. You will participate in the development of manual and automated test methods development by experimenting and debugging test methods. You will provide appropriate feedback helping our test engineers to optimize touch-time, validate repeatability and reproducibility, and minimize the impact on logistics involved in executing the test methods. You are a self-motivated individual who continuously seeks to improve performance by learning new skills, and tools and taking on new responsibilities. Duties And Responsibilities Conduct tests, collect data, and present results to stakeholders Prepare test specimens and consumables for test execution (ordering, sorting, identification) Verify status and support calibration & preventive maintenance of test equipment and fixtures Setup and break-down of equipment and fixtures Investigate and provide failure analysis documentation related to test method execution Operate various test equipment (ex. vernier scale, microscopes, tensile testing machine, multimeters, oscilloscope, temperature probes, data acquisition systems, drop testing, mechanical shock and vibration equipment) Participate and lead some test planning and scheduling activities (inventory management, transport to test vendors, disposal of test articles) Participate and lead some of the lab management activities such as lab audits, environmental monitoring. Develop and propose improvements to test fixtures using CAD software Record and analyze data to create test reports and present them to peers Review data records from other team members for proper use of good documentation practices Completes appropriate forms that support all aspects of test execution Participate in the development of test protocols and templates documentation Participate in knowledge transfer by training colleagues in proper executions of test methods Actively advocate lab order and safety through our 6S program. Assists with research and test method development Prepares and conducts experiments, collects data, analyzes data or records results Performs other related duties as required or assigned. Essential Skills Associate Degree in electronics, mechanical or electromechanical fields. Proficient with Microsoft productivity apps such as Word, Excel, and Outlook. Reads and understands documents such as protocols, test procedures, procedure instructions, equipment binder, policy manuals, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Proficient in the use of various electromechanical test equipment and measurement systems Excellent communication (written and verbal) and personal interaction skills. Detailed-oriented and organized with strong time management and prioritization skills. Travel Required Up to 25% Experience And Education Typically requires a minimum of 4-6 years of related experience and High School diploma/certificate or equivalent. Functional Description Supports engineering activities such as design, test, check-out, modification, fabrication and assembly of prototype electro mechanical systems, experimental design circuitry, laser/light transmission devices or specialized test equipment. Applications may include electronic circuits, photonics and logic systems. Works from schematics, diagrams, written and verbal descriptions, layouts or defined plans to perform testing, checkout and trouble-shooting functions. Performs operational test and fault isolation on systems and equipment. Assists in determining methods or actions to remedy malfunctions. Assists in the design, construction, test and check-out of test equipment. Uses manufacturing, test, development or diagnostic equipment, including, but not limited to, test programs, oscilloscopes, signal generators and specialized test apparatus. Functional/Business Knowledge Has obtained a broad understanding and knowledge of the job to perform a wide-range of tasks. Applies job skills and company policies and procedures to complete a variety of tasks. Scope Job requires the performance of work in accordance with standard practice, which enables the employee to proceed with reference of only questionable cases to the supervisor. Assignments are moderately complex in nature where ability to recognize deviation from accepted practice is required. Information exchanged may require diplomacy and tact. Judgement Normally receives little instruction on daily work, general instructions on newly introduced assignments. Nature of decisions demands a consistent accuracy as errors may cause some serious delay, waste of materials or loss of time due to rework or checking revised output. Summary As a key member of the material science group within Dexcom’s research and development organization, the Engineering Technician will work closely with other engineers, scientists, and technicians to support the development of next generation CGM sensor membrane material technologies. This is an exciting opportunity for an enthusiastic material processing expert with a clear understanding of the technical and regulatory challenges of developing and validating materials used in medical devices. The individual will be responsible for assisting in the equipment design, development, scaling, qualification, and operation of lab-scale processing unit operations and related analytical testing. In this capacity, the individual will also collaborate and communicate outside of the R&D organization including operations, supply chain, quality assurance, vendors, and other stakeholders. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Set-up samples and extractions for instrument preparation: HPLC, GCMS Be able to run set TP- Instrument methods Learn current LIMs and be able to process data Work as a Team member to produce high quality, attention-to-detail work Help maintain safety and lab stocks Maintain laboratory notebook, processing log, lot history record, procedural, inventory reports, productivity report, and other quality documentation. Prepare and communicate formal reports and presentations related to process work. Perform all work in accordance with Dexcom’s quality management systems and standard operating procedures. Maintains a safe and clean working environment. Required Qualifications Relevant industrial experience with an emphasis on Analytical chemistry and analytical sample preparation High attention to detail, accuracy and precision in sample preparation and processing of data Strong experimental skills and adept with data analysis methods/software. Must be organized and detail oriented. Excellent communication (written and verbal) and personal interaction skills. Preferred Qualifications Degree in relevant Science or Engineering desirable but not required. Experience in Analytical sample preparation and methodology GPC and HPLC instrument experience and understanding of Chromatography Proficiency with design of experiment (DOE) and basic statistical analysis. Efficient lab practices, workflow process and time management skills Proactive and creative in achieving goals with strong conflict resolution skills. Experience And Education Typically requires a minimum of 6-8 years of related experience and High School diploma/certificate or equivalent. Functional Description Supports engineering activities such as design, test, check-out, modification, fabrication and assembly of prototype electro mechanical systems, experimental design circuitry, laser/light transmission devices or specialized test equipment. Applications may include electronic circuits, photonics and logic systems. Works from schematics, diagrams, written and verbal descriptions, layouts or defined plans to perform testing, checkout and trouble-shooting functions. Performs operational test and fault isolation on systems and equipment. Assists in determining methods or actions to remedy malfunctions. Assists in the design, construction, test and check-out of test equipment. Uses manufacturing, test, development or diagnostic equipment, including, but not limited to, test programs, oscilloscopes, signal generators and specialized test apparatus. Functional/Business Knowledge Complete understanding of the aspects of the job. Applies high level of knowledge to complete a wide range of tasks that normally requires time management skills. Scope Work at this level requires following established practices. May independently plan own work, referring only unusual cases to supervisor. Frequent contact with employees at all levels within the company. Understands implications of work and makes recommendations for solutions. Judgement Assignments are complex in nature where judgment and initiative is required in resolving problems and making recommendations. Thoroughness and reliability are essential as errors would result in a possibility for loss and normally affect other groups. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported expected full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Conduct Preventive and Reparative Maintenance duties on Production, Manufacturing, and R&D Equipment and Fixtures. Ability to troubleshoot and maintain Automated production /process equipment, including PLC, Robotics 6 axis and pick and place robots, but not limited to Pneumatic systems, Hydraulic/Fluidics systems, Electro/Mechanical systems, packaging equipment, resistance/ultrasonic welders, heat stakers. Perform equipment moves and setups. Maintains and write Equipment Binders (EB), Maintain appropriate documents PM/CM documents, Pass-downs, Track-it work orders and performs IQ/OQ’s, equipment validations. Helps maintain spare part inventories. Ability to perform equipment activities in equipment development under supervision of the project engineer. Activities including assembly and testing of equipment, fixtures, processes and/or electronics, completing engineering studies and validations. Follow Dexcom’s Safety and Lock Out/Tag out (LOTO) program. Other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications 4-6+ years related production equipment, processes and/or electronics technician experience The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions . Preferred Qualifications Prior experience with electronics-based medical device development Electro-mechanical experience a plus Prior experience with Compliance test laboratories. Prior experience with low power microcontrollers in a battery powered system Schematic capture and PCB layout, design documentation Design for manufacture, test, cost and reliability Familiarity using Lab Test Equipment Excellent communicator both verbally and in written form Ability to work in a fast paced / dynamic team environment and possess time management skills to meet schedules Language Skills: Must be able to communicate effectively in English. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. May be required to perform the following Physical Activity: Standing, walking, sitting, using hands, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, talk or hear, taste or smell. May be required to lift 0 lbs. to over 100 lbs. Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. May be exposed to the following environmental conditions: Wet or humid conditions, work near moving parts, work in high - precarious places, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, outdoor weather conditions, extreme heat (non-weather), extreme cold (non-weather), risk of electric shock, work with explosives, risk of radiation, vibration. The noise level in this work environment can range from quiet to very loud. Please note: The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. The duties and responsibilities in this job description may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Functional Description Performs electrical or mechanical troubleshooting to determine problems in non-functioning electro-mechanical equipment used in the manufacturing process. Dismantles, adjusts, repairs and assembles equipment according to layout plans, blueprints, operating or repair manuals, rough sketches or drawings. Uses test and diagnostic equipment to perform checkouts. Rebuilds manufacturing equipment as required. May perform equipment modifications as directed by manufacturing engineers. Functional/Business Knowledge Complete understanding of the aspects of the job. Applies high level of knowledge to complete a wide range of tasks that normally requires time management skills. Scope Work at this level requires following established practices. May independently plan own work, referring only unusual cases to supervisor. Frequent contact with employees at all levels within the company. Understands implications of work and makes recommendations for solutions. Judgement Assignments are complex in nature where judgment and initiative is required in resolving problems and making recommendations. Thoroughness and reliability are essential as errors would result in a possibility for loss and normally affect other groups. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes.
