Summary Under the direction of the Sr. Manager of Automation Engineering, the Senior Automation Engineer provides technical support for the improvement, installation, validation and transfer of replicate custom automated equipment used in the scale-up of manufacturing for existing or new Dexcom products. These duties include leading or supporting cross functional equipment deployment teams while working with outside suppliers to meet equipment specifications and timelines. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Collaborates with cross functional teams and supports in the improvement and implementation of new replicate custom manufacturing equipment used in the manufacture of Dexcom products both at internal and external manufacturing sites. Works in close collaboration with Advanced Manufacturing Engineering, Site Engineering, R&D , and outside equipment suppliers to identify and implement improvements to custom equipment solutions that will improve reliability, efficiency, or yields. Travel to deployment sites, automation vendors, and contract partners to troubleshoot and test sustaining and new automation equipment. Provide technical input, review, and approval to validation documentation and support the execution of equipment qualifications as needed. Support the successful knowledge and tech transfer of new manufacturing platforms into manufacturing, which could include site to site transfers. Provide technical training to operators, manufacturing engineering and support staff for responsible equipment. Effectively implement problem solving skills and techniques to identify potential equipment risks and develop/implement mitigation plans as needed. Update equipment related documentations (manuals, drawings, and specifications) as needed. Exercise judgment within defined procedures and policies to determine appropriate action. This position assumes and performs other duties as assigned Demonstrated ability to identify project requirements and develop schedules with little to no assistance from more senior level engineering Actively contribute during technical design reviews. Effectively communicates with broad Dexcom team on project progress and challenges. Required Qualifications Experience planning, evaluation, and execution of equipment commissioning and validation procedures, including FAT, SAT, IQ, and OQ. Technical writing skills as applied to manufacturing documentation and process development in a highly regulated industry- Experienced in the creation and revision of technical documentation. Knowledge of GDP/GMP as they relate to high reliability, high volume manufacturing equipment, and processes. Ability to run self-directed projects, leverage networked team resources, maintain timelines, stay organized, and prioritize multiple activities. Experience procuring and deploying capital equipment and knowledge of capital expenditure processes. Excellent communication (written and verbal) and personal interaction skills. Demonstrated ability to influence, motivate, and accomplish results through peers and junior level engineers Proven ability to work hands-on in a fast-paced environment. Ability to deal with ambiguity/uncertainty and a willingness to try new/challenging things. Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 5-8 years related experience or Master’s degree and 2-5 years equivalent industry experience Preferred Qualifications Medical device experience Lean Six Sigma or Six Sigma training and certification preferred Experience in designing, programming, and deploying custom automated manufacturing equipment for use in the medical industry highly desired. Experience with industrial control systems software, SCADA, and related communication protocols is highly desired. Functional Description Provides expertise in engineering, design, installation and start-up of automation systems. Actively assists manufacturing operations in problem solving with regards to the automated systems. Assists in the validation of process and facility automation. jobTitle: Sr Clinical Account Trainer - Great Plains District
jobDescription: About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported expected full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Position Summary The Clinical Account Manager (CAM) position is focused on driving business growth through clinical support to health care providers, including Physicians, Certified Diabetes Educators, Pharmacists and other health care professionals (HCP). The CAM will provide education and training regarding DEXCOM personal and professional products. The CAM is an extension of a collaborative Sales team. A successful CAM will have clinical and professional acumen necessary to meet the training and sales goals, while exceeding business objectives, in an assigned district. The CAM will be comfortable collaborating with both internal and external customers and be able to assess their needs accurately. The CAM provides detailed, technically complex information to HCPs to facilitate the beneficial therapeutic relationship between the patient, provider and company. The CAM will perform training, education, and support to HCP virtually and/or face-to-face, using a variety of technology, including video conferences, conference calls, webinars, and phone. Essential Duties And Responsibilities High volume, inbound communication from Physicians, Pharmacists, and other Health Care Providers about CGM Ability to network with internal and external colleagues across multiple disciplines Training and on-boarding for Health Care Professionals Train HCPs on Dexcom professional products, software, and mobile technology Drive collaboration and maintain consistent open lines of communication across assigned responsibilities Facilitate training one-on-one and in large groups Required Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Ability to multi-task effectively, and to work both independently and in a team environment. Strong attention to detail by being exact, precise and accurate. An individual must demonstrate good judgement and techniques for obtaining results and be able to assist in determining the objective of an assignment. An individual in this position would be considered a ‘subject matter expert’ on Continuous Glucose Monitoring. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential function. Also requires willingness to work a flexible schedule which may include weekends and/or evening work. Required license in one or more fields: Certified Diabetes Care and Education Specialist (CDCES), Registered Nurse (RN), Registered Dietitian (RD), Physician’s Assistant (PA), Nurse Practitioner (NP) Direct experience and expertise working with continuous glucose monitoring therapy Extensive knowledge of diabetes and therapies Competency with Microsoft PowerPoint, Outlook, Excel, and Video conferencing Excellent communication and presentation skills Prior sales and/or business experience preferred Preferred experience in the medical device industry or pharmaceuticals Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 5-8 years of related experience. Travel Required 25 – 49% Must reside in assigned Sales District To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Dexcom. Only authorized staffing and recruiting agencies may use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes on specific requisitions. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additionaloffices in the U.S., Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Summary Implement and monitor clinical studies at participating study sites according to the FDA Code of Federal Regulations (CFR), Good Clinical Practices (GCP), and ICH Guidelines. Works with other CRAs and Clinical Affairs management to assist in the conduct of Dexcom-sponsored clinical studies (including In-House studies). Responsible for conducting site visits, monitoring, and performing all ancillary requirements in executing clinical studies to ensure proper data collection and write-up for documentation or submission of clinical study data. Essential Duties And Responsibilities With supervision by clinical affairs director, assess clinical investigators, study staff, and contract research organizations (if applicable) for compliance with study protocols, regulations, and Dexcom Standard Operating Procedures. Implements or escalates appropriate corrective action as needed. Prepares detailed reports surrounding study setup, study progress, and findings from monitoring/closeout visits. With supervision by clinical affairs director, plans, conducts and monitors Dexcom-sponsored clinical studies (including In-House studies) and provides requested clinical support to externally-sponsored studies (investigator-initiated, industry-sponsored, etc.) With assistance by clinical affairs director, writes study reports and helps develop clinical study materials (including, but not limited to, source documentation, CRFs, IRB submissions, training slides, etc.). Researches and collects information on regulatory/clinical requirements and standards. Works on multiple projects related to in house and out of house feasibility clinical trials. Effectively supports project team to perform routine department tasks and protocol writing. Elevates concerns or problems to management team and contributes to the day-to-day harmony within the department. Adapts to changing priorities. Acts as a study coordinator for in-house clinical studies. Conducts interim monitoring visits. This position will assume other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications Nursing or diabetes experience desirable, but not mandatory. GCP training is desirable. Past experience as a Clinical Research Aide or CRA is highly desirable. Experience in the medical device industry. Industry certification is desirable (e.g., SOCRA CCRP, ACRP CCRA, etc.), but not required. Travel Required The job will require traveling up to 25% - 30% of the time; some international travel may be required. jobTitle: Sr Director and Manufacturing Site Head
jobDescription: We are seeking an energetic leader for the role of Site Head, Sr Director. This role will report directly to the Vice President of Manufacturing (Americas) and will be responsible for directing and guiding the activities of a US Manufacturing site in the Dexcom Manufacturing Network. The ideal candidate will be a collaborative leader who will play a key role embedding the Dexcom culture and enabling the execution of the US manufacturing strategy. They will manage the day-to-day operations and inventory management activities necessary to ensure appropriate levels of finished goods, intermediate product, work-in-progress, and raw materials. This role will also lead the development and implementation of optimized manufacturing processes as defined by the Global Operations Strategy. The site head is responsible for direct oversight of the manufacturing personnel on-site and the indirect oversight of all non-manufacturing personnel as their work supports product production. The role will be based in Mesa, AZ and will require travel between sites to maintain alignment. Responsibilities Strategy / Planning: Ensure budgets, schedules, and performance metrics are consistently met; Effectively share status up, down, and sideways within the organization. Represent the company in industry business conferences. Set goals aligned to the global manufacturing strategy- establish priorities, manage resources, develop concepts and approaches, reviews projects progress and results; Make sound decisions to prevent serious impacts on the overall success of manufacturing operations. Produce products that meet customer expectations by formulating, installing, and enforcing good manufacturing practices; developing and improving production and engineering processes; designing production planning and control systems and procedures; developing and enforcing inspection and quality assurance standards, procedures, and methods. Ensure compliance with agency procedures, programs, and government regulations (FDA, ISO, and OSHA) and maintain good working relationships with regulatory authorities. People / Collaboration Directly supervises employees. Performs management responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of employees to include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; measuring performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing employee complaints and resolving problems; advising employees on people related issues. Develop leadership in others -- focus upon personal and collective accountability while fostering an environment that enhances personal growth and career development through mentoring and training; performance management and challenging the organization to strive for higher performance levels. Effective succession planning with focus on diversity and inclusion. Act as a Leader and key member of the senior management team, foster a proactive approach, and recommend and implement solutions to site wide issues to drive performance, enabling the company to meet and exceed its short-term and long-term objectives. Manage manufacturing operational issues by acting as the primary liaison with other members of management, engineering, supply chain, clinical and regulatory, quality assurance, quality control, sales and marketing teams. Operations / Manufacturing Process Exercise astute judgment, within broadly defined practices and policies; Resolve complex problems in which collaboration and analysis are required, often under tight timelines Ensure the manufacturing organization is committed to and conforms to the company quality system procedures, as documented Develop and manage clear and effective performance metrics for the manufacturing organization as a whole, as well as individuals, measuring the effectiveness; use metric trends and data to drive the business and decisions therein. Increase the overall productivity of the manufacturing operations organization as evidenced by lower cost, higher quality solutions provided on time. Create and implement a vision for continual improvement of operational services at a detail level as well as higher organizational level; partner with others to establish methodologies to resolve process issues. Manage all aspects of operations cycle within operational budgets and functional goals of the facility. Build a reputation for the manufacturing site of high integrity, competitive and proactive leadership, and sustained performance by delivering quality product on a timely basis. Qualifications Experience leading a large team of direct and indirect reports with a heavy population of hourly employees Effectively operates in a complex and matrixed environment Proven track record of scaling manufacturing operations in a 24/7 manufacturing environment Experience dealing with complexity in an industry with strict regulations and quality requirements. Outstanding leadership skills with the ability to affect change in an organization utilizing a cross-functional, collaborative approach. Communicate information and ideas clearly, and concisely, in writing; read and understand information presented in writing; listen to, and understand, information and ideas as presented verbally. Consistently operates in a collaborative manner. Applies emotional intelligence in day to day and change management. Functional Description Directs the development and implementation of activities in production area(s) to meet production goals, quality, and cost objectives. Prioritizes production schedules based on product introduction, equipment efficiency, and materials supply. Plans and administers procedures and budgets. Makes budgetary recommendations and at higher levels, controls capital expenditures and direct/indirect labor. Develops schedules and manpower requirements for assigned areas. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses in-depth knowledge of the leading practices of a functional area and familiarity with several others. Fully understands and translates organization, business strategies, and company goals to functional priorities. Scope Makes final decisions on administrative or operational matters and ensures effective achievement of objectives. Interacts internally and externally with others, requiring negotiation of extremely critical matters. Recognized as an influential leader throughout the organization. Influences policymaking. Judgement Consistently works with abstract ideas or situations across functional areas of the business. Thorough assessment of factors, identifies and evaluates fundamental issues, providing strategy and direction. Erroneous decisions will have a long-term effect on the company's success. Management Effectively able to operate in complex or matrix environment. Directs and controls the activities of one or more functional areas, divisions, product groups or service areas through senior managers who have overall responsibility for the successful operation of those assigned areas. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree with 17+ years of industry experience. 13+ years of years of successful leadership experience in relevant industry. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary This position will report directly to the Corporate VP, Strategic Planning and Dexcom Labs. The strategic and competitive insights group is responsible for providing strategic insights, tracking and analysis of the competitive market place and products relevant to Dexcom’s strategy and products particularly in the areas of continuous sensing, continuous glucose monitoring (CGM), health wearables, diabetes device companies, and emerging trends in health care. The role will manage the daily monitoring, report out, and organizational interactions of the Strategic and Competitive Insights group. The role will be in the Corporate Strategic Planning team, with an opportunity to interface with Finance, Corporate Development, Information Technology, R&D functional groups, Legal, Advance Technology R&D, Upstream Marketing, Clinical and IP groups. We are looking for a leader with a medical technical background, business acumen, financial modeling, project management experience, and strong communication skills. The ideal candidate will be effective in digesting and summarizing large amounts of incoming data, able to maintain multiple concurrent projects, skilled in drafting robust written documentation and communication, and interface with technical and non-technical internal stakeholders. Preferred previous experience in a competitive intelligence roles. The Primary Activities For This Role Include Lead teams supporting the strategic and competitive insights framework and data based to support annual and long-term strategic planning. Provide vision and oversight for the development and maintenance of strategic competitive intelligence database Lead and develop data-supported assessments to guide strategy and generate the key insights required to inform strategic decisions, potentially spanning discovery through the go-to-market planning. Provide management and board level competitive and strategic market updates and what-if scenario planning Maintain summaries and regular communication with stakeholders Oversee research, analysis and tracking of market sizing and data tracking healthcare trends and market sizing data. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary We are the technology leader in diabetes management and patient satisfaction. We have become the standard bearer in the emerging digital health space. We are looking for a passionate hardware engineer to join our San Diego team. This position is for a Senior Electrical Engineer who will be working on sustaining projects to ensure continuity, scale, and improvement of our products. The position requires strong engineering fundamentals, leadership skills, and most importantly a desire to improve our products for our patients. Duties And Responsibilities Complete projects by working within a cross-functional team including partners in R&D, manufacturing, external contract manufacturers, compliance, and other groups as necessary. Lead escalated technical root cause investigations from field and manufacturing leveraging structured problem-solving methodologies. Technical trade-off studies and down-selection for different design approaches through research, analysis, and testing. Start to finish ownership of electrical designs including component selection, circuit design, and layout. This includes requirement definition, prototype, design, verification, and transfer to manufacturing. Perform electrical verification activities including developing test protocols, test execution, and test reports. Provide input and guidance in design and technical reviews. Guide and mentor early career engineers. Essential Skills Strong EE fundamentals with demonstrated experience implementing electrical designs. Experience in developing, debugging, and testing low power, battery operated, wireless, microcontroller-based designs. Experience with analog sensing circuits, preferable experience with very low current sensing methods. Experience in PCBA design including schematic capture, PCB layout, and transferring designs to manufacturing. Proficiency with EE tools and RF testers (scopes, network analyzers, spectrum analyzer, signal generator and etc.). Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey technical and business information clearly and effectively through informal and formal documents, reports, and presentations to senior management Ability to work in a fast paced / dynamic team environment and possess time management skills to meet schedules Preferred Qualifications Experienced in Design for manufacturability, reliability, test, and cost for high volume products Experience in implementing and maintaining products with wireless communication such as Bluetooth, Wi-Fi or cellular Experience in verification of wireless chips and antennas. Prior experience with product development process for medical devices, particularly design control requirements and GMP requirements Experience using statistical tools such as JMP for data analytics Bluetooth LE implementation is a plus with experience in design, selection and verification of wireless chips and antennas. Using simulation tools to model and analyze RF circuits and PCBAs Firmware programming of microcontrollers is a plus Experience in gaining regulatory and safety certifications including FCC, UL, CE. Travel Required Up to 25% Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 5-8 years related experience or Masters degree and 2-5 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 0-2 years experience. Functional Description Responsible for designing, developing, modifying and evaluating electronic parts, components or integrated circuitry for electronic equipment and other hardware systems. Determines design approaches and parameters. Analyzes equipment to establish operating data, conducts experimental tests and evaluates results. Selects components and equipment based on analysis of specifications and reliability. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses broad understanding of technical principles and theories. Ability to synthesize external data and research findings for application that may impact technical objectives. Scope Demonstrates successes in technical proficiency and independent thought. Works on complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Exercises judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Judgement Exercises good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary The role is responsible for supporting efforts to strengthen and expand product security operations across Dexcom’s product lines and portfolio through managing cybersecurity resources such as penetration testing and threat modeling. The role will serve as a key member of the product security leadership team. The candidate will lead security testing, and threat modeling efforts of Dexcom product security framework ensuring that best practice objectives are achieved for product and data integrity, availability, and confidentiality. This role is responsible for cybersecurity testing of all products that have been released to our customers as well as the security testing of the cloud infrastructure that they run on. An ideal candidate will have an unshakeable foundation in the technical aspects of security, engineering, defect exploitation, and are solution focused. The candidate will be an effective communicator with technical and non-technical people alike and are quickly able to establish credibility and trust. The candidate is comfortable leading and guiding at all levels necessary to achieve objectives. The candidate must understand the need to maintain active partnerships and alliances with team members and counterparts in order to keep lock-stepped with business direction and prepare the way for successful security integration. The candidate is capable of understanding when something is not meeting security expectations and act with a sense of urgency in order to achieve security objectives. The role will work alongside highly skilled and passionate cybersecurity professionals who know how to deliver exceptional results while also having some fun along the way. For this role, a candidate would be joining Dexcom’s Research and Development Cybersecurity team to design and implement new applications and features for Dexcom’s medical device platforms. As a member of the R&D Cybersecurity team, you will be responsible for reviewing new and existing technologies, identifying, and ranking potential risks, providing remediation/mitigation suggestions and direction, as well as documenting your findings for review. Additionally, you will be responsible for working with the various development teams and product managers to ensure that new projects are properly secured. Duties And Responsibilities Effectively collaborate with all Dexcom teams with direct accountability to build and oversee the post-market cybersecurity strategy, vision, and roadmap with a relentless focus on balancing security with simplification Effectively communicates with and influences key stakeholders across the enterprise, at all levels of the organization Internal/external network-based penetration tests Software/firmware/application testing Low-level hardware attacks including fault-injection & side-channel attacks High-Level hardware attacks such as identification & analysis of serial communications Bare-metal firmware reverse engineering ARM Reverse Engineering & Exploit Development (including iOS & Android) Mobile application (iOS/Android) high-level penetration testing Web API & UI black box penetration testing Wireless protocol testing (Bluetooth & NFC) Participate in security requirements and design reviews Review security requirements and design specifications. Create testing plans, procedures, and risk analyses Test the configuration, functionality, and user interface of mobile applications and tools Design, develop, execute, and maintain automated and manual test scripts to test mobile device security. Document technical issues identified during security testing and write reports. Analyze vulnerabilities and security gaps then collaborate with development teams to ensure issues are resolved Follow internal software development, cybersecurity, and validation procedures that comply with medical and security regulations. Modify test protocols based on requirement changes Attend design review meetings to identify and document any potential security risks in cloud or mobile implementations Work with Development Operations (DevOps) to review currently deployed applications and their supporting infrastructure for potential security risks. Advise DevOps team members on security best-practices Essential Skills 3 or more years of successful experience as a Sr. Manager or Director of Security. Strong management skills with the ability to build and lead cohesive and productive teams. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with all levels of management through diplomacy and tact. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Deep technical expertise and thought leadership to design, implement and accelerate the adoption of the best security operations practices Ensure the pentesting and threat modeling teams maintain knowledge of security industry innovations, trends, and best practices Role models and mentors, helping to coach and strengthen the team skills Someone who loves security and who works stay aware of new threats and advances in security. Not afraid to question the existing way if a better way exists. Requires strong security experience, excellent communication skills, and mature leadership and management abilities Assessing the initial impact of security vulnerabilities to the organization’s product portfolio Offering leadership and guidance regarding vulnerability response and potential risk to the business Assigning and populating CVEs, CVSS scoring, etc. as needed and working to ensure vulnerabilities are remediated within their SLAs Evangelizing Coordinated Vulnerability Disclosure (CVD), negotiating with suppliers and security researchers and publishing communication of a fix or mitigation via Security Advisories Teamwork, leading and following, including the ability to drive projects and initiatives in multiple departments Demonstrated ability to identify risks associated with business processes, operations, information security programs, and technology projects The ability to be an enterprise security subject matter expert who can explain technical topics to those without a technical background Information Security Fundamentals - 5 years of experience or BS degree (or higher) in a technical discipline Experienced in vulnerability assessment and penetration testing methodologies Understanding of various cloud solutions and cloud penetration testing methodologies A strong understanding of various forms of network architecture Experience with using a security-based risk scoring system (CVSS) Knowledge of OWASP top ten vulnerabilities for web applications and APIs Preferred Qualifications 5 successive years as a security manager or director Experience with governance, standards, and compliance standards/requirements Experience in the Medical Industry Professional Security Certifications such as CISSP, CCSP, CISA, CISM, ITIL Cloud Computing certifications such as CCSK, AWS, Azure, and GCP Experience with threat modeling and hazard-analysis frameworks such as STAMP, STRIDE, etc. Experience leveraging the MITRE ATT&CK™ Framework Strong knowledge of industry standards as they relate to Cloud and Application security management including ISO, NIST, and Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) Exp

Functional Description: Professional Individual Contributor Coordinates microbiological testing, release of product and testing for validation protocols. Performs organism identification. Performs technical review of batch filling records to ensure quality of aseptic processes. Reads and interprets microbiological cultures and other related tests including but not limited to environmental monitoring, sterility tests, growth promotion, microbial limits tests and antimicrobial effectiveness tests. May perform validation, technology transfer and troubleshooting, and write policy procedure for quality initiatives. Reviews and approves environmental monitoring data and laboratory equipment and records. Prepares process and status reports, assigns and monitors document numbers and reviews documents for accuracy and completeness. Must have education and/or experience suitable for work in a biopharmaceutical or pharmaceutical manufacturing or similar environment. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Supports environmental particulate and microbial testing for ISO certified cleanrooms, Heating Ventilation & Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems, Compressed Air Gas Systems, and Pharmaceutical Grade Water Systems. Maintains regulatory compliance of the Microbiology monitoring program for the Heating Ventilation & Air Conditioning (HVAC) systems, Compressed Air and Gas Systems, and Pharmaceutical Grade Water Systems. Supports all tasks related to laboratory upkeeping and the environmental monitoring program. Assesses changes to cleanroom environments by supporting the Equipment Transfer Plan program. Coordinates and supports facility, equipment, and HVAC maintenance events between multiple departments. Performs risk assessments for deviations, OOS events, CAPAs, NCMRs, and COPs. Develops, generates, and supports Performance Qualification and Validation protocols and reports. Develops test method validations in support of microbiology operations. Performs risk assessments for changes related to manufacturing process changes, product development, material biocompatibility, and product changes. Develops and validates new microbiological test methods. Develops equipment, process cleaning and disinfection validations. Maintains regulatory compliance of the sterilization program for sterile implantable devices by performing process re-qualifications, new product qualifications, and risk assessments. Ensures regulatory compliance of product and material biocompatibility by performing safety assessments and testing for sterile implantable medical devices to support existing product and/or process changes and new products. Performs supplier audits to assess changes impacting sterilization and biocompatibility Works and communicates effectively and professionally with others inside and outside the company. Leads the team to properly execute and complete daily tasks per schedule under the guidelines of established Dexcom Standard Operating Procedures (SOP sand cGMP regulations) supports the sterilization program and work with quality regulations and guidelines to ensure compliance in the microbiological testing. Trains and reviews work of less senior level Microbiologist Flexibility to perform other duties, as assigned, or as business needs require. Required Qualifications Knowledge of the following standards and regulations: 21 CFR 820, ISO 13485, CMDR, and EEC93/42, US and EU Pharmacopeia <61>, <85>, <161>, <1231>, <645>, AAMI/TIR 30, AAMI/TIR 52, International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 10993, 14644, 11137, 11737, 14971, and other risk guidance standards Must have advance knowledge of HEPA filtration, purified water systems and clean room principles to assist with OOS and excursion investigations. Experience in monitoring of environmental systems (HVAC, Cleanroom, Compressed Air, Compressed Gases, Water) Experience in maintaining, supporting, and developing test methods for sterilization of medical devices and biocompatibility testing. Must be able to work under pressure of met constant deadlines. Absolutely must be able to work as a member of a team. Must be able to organize and use time efficiently. Preferred Qualification A Minimum of 5 years of experience in a Microbiology Lab and Medical device industry experience Experience with pro-longed contact and permanent implantable devices Strong knowledge of cGMPs, GLP, FDA, USP and AAMI guidelines for control environments and sterilization of medical devices. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported expected full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Summary In this role as a Senior Engineer – Process Development, you will use sound and proven engineering principles to assist in designing and developing processes and requirements. The projects and activities will focus on Dexcom’s sensor technology. Working as a member of a technology team, you will collaborate with other engineers, management, and operators. This position will lead efforts to prove out manufacturing and automation processes to achieve design requirements specified by R&D, and explore and evaluate new technologies and concepts through analysis, prototyping, fixture design, and experimentation. This position will transfer and scale up new products from R&D. Involvement may begin from feasibility at vendors to full scale manufacturing. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Design, document and optimize new manufacturing process/assembly steps and operating procedures for new stations, equipment, and processes within a regulated quality system. Demonstrate hands-on process understanding and provide guidance and training with pilot plant operators on engineering level builds. Develop and maintain project timelines and provide updates and feedback to project leadership. Design and develop fixtures and equipment components required to meet process goals from concept to implementation. Create and release equipment specifications and drawings, establish calibration and preventative maintenance requirements. Implement, characterize, and optimize processes, mechanical tests, and fixtures/jigs for assembly, inspection and test through implementation of measurement systems, part inspections, MSA, and capability analysis. Identify process risks and track mitigations through standard methods. Assist in scaling up equipment and processes from prototype to pilot to full scale manufacturing. Provide design and assembly requirements working within scope as determined by business and schedule needs. Plan and perform Design of Experiments (DOE) to characterize and determine optimal processing methods Collaborate with external vendors to produce equipment, materials, and/or parts that meet determined product specifications Perform statistically robust and industry standard analysis of data, and present findings to technical teams Exercise judgment within defined procedures and policies to determine appropriate action. This position assumes and performs other duties as assigned. Demonstrate hands-on process understanding and provide guidance and training to operators and techs on engineering builds Assist in the development of project timelines and provide technical updates and feedback to project leadership Design and develop fixtures and equipment components required to meet process goals from concept to implementation Assist in scaling up equipment and processes from prototype to pilot to full scale manufacturing This position assumes and performs other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications Proven track record of running self-directed projects, maintaining aggressive timelines, and executing in a fast-paced environment Mastery of statistical process control, design of experiments, and critical parameter development/management Experience executing Measurement System Analysis, and Gage Reliability & Reproducibility studies Experience developing and executing IQ/OQ/PQ Strong proficiency with data analysis methods and statistical analysis software (i.e. JMP, Minitab or equivalent) Experience launching products in regulated industry (e.g. medical device, pharma) Proficiency in the use of SolidWorks or equivalent CAD software Knowledge of high reliability, high volume manufacturing processes and designs Ability to deal with ambiguity/uncertainty and a willingness to try new/challenging things Demonstrated competency in experimental design, execution, and interpretation of data to drive critical product/process decisions Detail oriented with strong time management skills Excellent communication (written and verbal) and conflict management skills Preferred Qualifications Medical device experience Lean Six Sigma or Six Sigma DMAIC methodology Understanding of CPDM/DFSS concepts Understanding of industry best practices (e.g. Industry 4.0 concepts) Manufacturing or sustaining experience Experience in DFA/DFM Sterilization, stability, and biocompatibility Functional Description Develops new or modified process formulations, defines processing or handling equipment requirements and specifications, and reviews processing techniques and methods applied in the manufacture, fabrication, and evaluation of products. Involvement may begin at any step from pilot plant to full-scale manufacturing. Coordinates design requirement review with appropriate engineering/scientific personnel to ensure compatibility of processing methods. Compiles and evaluates test data to determine appropriate limits and variables for process or material specifications. May conceive and plan projects involving definition and selection of new concepts, equipment automation technology, and approaches in the processing or development of new or improved processes. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses broad understanding of technical principles and theories. Ability to synthesize external data and research findings for application that may impact technical objectives. Scope Demonstrates successes in technical proficiency and independent thought. Works on complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Exercises judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Judgement Exercises good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 5-8 years related experience or Masters degree and 2-5 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 0-2 years experience. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary Key contributor to the administration of the following Dexcom compliance functions: Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA), Non-Conforming Events (NCE), Nonconforming Material Reports, and Internal Audits. Assist management to ensure that products, procedures, processes, contracts and services comply with applicable federal and state rules and regulations, as well as international standards. A seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of area of specialization; resolves a wide range of issues in creative ways. Demonstrates further technical development and a track record of project success. Demonstrates an ability to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously. Considered a specialist in the field within the function. Duties And Responsibilities Review CAPA documentation for content and completion of required deliverables. Provide guidance as necessary to ensure appropriate depth of investigation and corrective and/or preventive actions. Assess effectiveness of corrective and preventive actions. Prepare CAPA Review Board meeting agenda and minutes. Review nonconformance trending to identify need for corrective or preventive actions. Perform Internal Audits as Lead Auditor or member of the Audit Team. Participate in audit preparation, execution, and audit reporting. Track completion of audit responses and verify effectiveness of actions taken. Compile CAPA and Internal Audit performance metrics for review with management. Perform duties of Recall Coordinator in association with the Company’s Corrections and Removals Policy. Create or revise Standard Operating Procedures and Work Instructions governing the Company’s compliance functions. Assist management with continuous improvement of processes and systems supporting the Company’s compliance functions. Stay current on applicable FDA, ISO and other applicable industry requirements. Monitor external publication sources for issues applicable to the Company. Create training materials and execute training as necessary to communicate process requirements and provide guidance to user community. Conduct investigations into potential quality / compliance concerns. Keep management informed of issues. Compiling metrics and data analysis in the following area: Metrics for Management review Metrics for partner meetings Trending Pareto analysis to drive projects / activities Input to PFTs Ad-hoc metrics to support investigations Dashboards E-GEMBA (align with Mesa and Malaysia mfg. sites) Overall, improve data comprehension in order to move to predictive activities Use data to drive process improvements (reduced inspection time) Perform other tasks as assigned to enable organizational and quality objectives to be met. Essential Skills Direct experience with Quality Management Systems, Nonconforming Material, Nonconforming Events, CAPA, and Internal Auditing. Good understanding of QMS as applied to medical devices. Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. Collaborative, able to work effectively with diverse functional groups. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Will analyze and extract data from Dexcom information systems for business decisions. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for problem solving and obtaining solutions. Minimum 5 years of quality or regulatory compliance experience in the medical device and/or pharmaceutical industries (other regulated industries may be considered). jobTitle: Sr. Staff Cybersecurity Engineer - Enterprise Product Security
jobDescription: About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. provides continuous glucose monitoring technology to help patients and their clinicians better manage diabetes. Since our inception, we have focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions for people with diabetes - while empowering our community to take control of diabetes. Position Summary The Dexcom IT Department is seeking a Senior Staff Cybersecurity Engineer – Enterprise Product Security to serve as a hands-on security architect, technical lead of enterprise product security, and implementor of security controls across cloud, DevOps, and software development domains. The position will partner with SMEs across the Information Security (Infosec), DevOps and Applications teams to secure the IT department’s rapidly growing cloud, microservices and enterprise applications environments. The position will represent product security interests in the Technology Advisory Group (TAG) and Solution Review Board (SRB) meetings. The position will establish security architecture, document security standards, and influence adoption of security best practices in a fast-pace, high-growth environment. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Establish security architecture and best practices for securing public cloud platforms (GCP, AWS, Azure) and DevOps technology stacks (Kubernetes, containers, serverless). Partner with DevOps to implement cloud security “landing zones” where security controls are codified in Terraform and all changes to the cloud environment are made via Gitops. Perform security assessments of cloud or DevOps technology deployments. Integrate security checks into CI/CD pipelines and develop Policy as Code using Hashicorp Sentinel or similar technologies. Design security monitoring and threat detection systems for cloud and container environments. Integrate cloud/DevOps security tools into the SIEM (Splunk) and implement processes for alerting and remediation anomalous activities. Support cloud compliance/certification activities and participate in security audits/reviews. Provide consulting and influence other teams to mature product security capabilities. Serve as a security expert and provide technical leadership to other staff members. Help establish appsec capabilities and integrate SAST/DAST tools into the build pipeline. Previous experience performing threat modeling. Required Qualifications BS/MS in computer science/engineering, information technology, or technical field. 8+ years of experience in the cybersecurity, IT, or engineering fields; with 4+ years in a senior security engineer or higher role. jobTitle: Sr Staff Software Development Engineer - Software Architect
jobDescription: The success of our R&D Software team has inspired a progressive, Remote-First work model. This format allows our staff the benefits of a primary, work from home-office in one of four HUB locations, as well as, the value of collaborative engagement. When meaningful & purposeful opportunities occur, our Remote-First teams may gather in-person at hub locations (Pacific Northwest, Pacific Southwest, Midwest and Texas). About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary The success of our R&D Software team has inspired a progressive, Remote-First work model. This format allows our staff the benefits of a primary, work from home-office in one of four HUB locations, as well as, the value of collaborative engagement. When meaningful & purposeful opportunities occur, our Remote-First teams may gather in-person at hub locations (Pacific Northwest, Pacific Southwest, Midwest and Texas) Within the R&D Software Architecture team, this engineer/architect will work with marketing as well as firmware, data, software, and mobile app engineering subject matter experts to define architecture as well as define and guide the process of architecture development, and software development. They will need to use sound and proven systems engineering principles, best practices and concepts in order to capture and develop technology and product requirements from internal and external stakeholders, understand and quantify product use conditions, support the design of software architectures, identify/manage product interfaces, resolve/optimize tradeoffs between conflicting requirements, lead technology ideation, proof of concept, and down-selection activities, facilitate communication between functional teams, and plan/execute subsystem and system integration testing and verification. This engineer may also lead or support activities to understand the current and future needs of our customers and our business, explore and evaluate new technologies and concepts for meeting those needs, and rapidly demonstrate feasibility of such technologies through rigorous modeling, analysis, prototyping, experimentation, and other risk identification and mitigation activities. Working as a member of a technology team, this engineer will collaborate and communicate with company management, marketing, quality assurance, alliance partners and other departments and vendors. This engineer is also expected to serve as an authority and advocate for the effective and consistent application of Software Architecture across intra-departmental groups and processes. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Provides input on direction for key strategic decisions relating to technology and products Identifies technology directions which can accelerate product development and provide competitive advantages Architects and advises on technical issues of a complex systems Communicates project technical details and issues to management Expert in technology in their area of expertise and independently suggests or develops new techniques and procedures to improve design process and product Exhibits a high degree of diligence and enforces team standards Identify customer, business needs, and use conditions and translate those needs into software architecture pattern that will fulfill the needs Define, resolve, manage, and/or optimize tradeoffs between conflicting requirements Design new software architectures and identify/manage associated interfaces Identify, track, and actively reduce technical, project, and business risks Understand regulatory standards for medical equipment and develop strategies and plans for implementing them within technology development and product commercialization efforts Support subsystem and system integration testing Independently plan, manage and prioritize tasks/projects, track progress toward overall goals, and provide periodic updates to management Participate on technology and development teams by acquiring knowledge of product function and use conditions and contribute to the design reviews through defining and managing requirements, identifying issues, and recommending design improvements Appropriately apply technical knowledge and systems engineering tools/methodologies to drive program activities and reduce risk Contribute to advancing the software engineering practice at Dexcom by identifying and implementing best-in-class tools/techniques/methods Take a direct lead technical role on certain high priority or challenging technology, process, or test efforts when the needs of the business so dictate Take on various leadership responsibilities, as delegated by management, such as providing direction, mentoring, and technical guidance of development efforts. Other duties as assigned Required Qualifications Proven history of mobile development with several commercial apps available on an app store Ability to understand company intent for the application and align the design and development efforts Must have strong communication skills to discuss tradeoffs between design options Actively seeks discussions for design direction when direction is not obvious Ability to work in a structured corporate company in a regulated industry Ability to enact change that benefits entire team. Has a broad technical vision for the organization. High degree of diligence in documentation, testing and coding. Proven ability to work hands-on in a fast-paced environment Ability to deal with ambiguity/uncertainty and a willingness to try new/challenging things Knowledge of product lifecycle to provide technical leadership Proficiency with software tools for requirements management, engineering analysis, and statistical analysis. Demonstrated technical project management skills on multi-year projects with multi-functional teams Ability to communicate (verbal and writing) with engineers, management, marketing, health care professionals and patients Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills Experience with medical devices and working in a regulated industry Travel Required Up to 25% Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 13+ years related experience or a Masters degree and 8+ years equivalent industry experience of a PhD and 5+ years of experience. May interact with users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications. Develops, modifies, and executes software test plans, automates scripts and programs for testing. Analyzes and writes test standards and procedures. Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software. Analyzes test results to ensure existing functionality and recommends corrective action. Provides feedback in preparation of technical appraisals of programming languages, systems, and computation software. Ensures quality computer integration into the overall functions of scientific computation, data acquisition, and processing. Travel and expenses will be reimbursed for this travel if you live outside of commuting distance (typically 75 miles/120km) of your assigned Dexcom site.

Position Summary The Senior Technical Writer is part of the R&D organization in Product Security, and is responsible for writing technical documents and formal risk assessments detailing cybersecurity, privacy, system architecture, compliance, and other technical topics. Requires an understanding of technical details and the ability to write documents for internal and external auditors, regulatory bodies, and component development teams. Requires attention to detail and conformity with defined formal processes. Duties And Responsibilities Create documents detailing the technical implementation of security and privacy requirements for internal and external development teams; internal and external auditors; and regulatory bodies or customers requiring disclosure of our practices. Work with the lead technical writer with creating formal risk assessment reports following a defined formal risk assessment process. Coordinate with program management staff on the steps needed for security reviews and the development of formal reports. Develop technical data-flow diagrams in conjunction with peer technical writers and engineering leads to achieving a shared understanding of proposed architectural designs. Write non-technical overview descriptions of components and services that provide stakeholders with a summary of system architecture and other program decisions. Ensure all deliverables maintain a simple, succinct content flow with correct grammar and spelling. Meet with stakeholders, including development teams, to understand their documentation needs from our team and ensure the documentation is of an appropriate level of thoroughness. Collaborate with various subject matter experts from Engineering, Quality, Regulatory, Verification &Validation, Document Control, and Program Management Employ efficient research practices to quickly understand and accurately document complex software systems and interfaces Demonstrate excellent attention to detail with a focus on quality, consistency, and accuracy Ability to work with little supervision and resolve problems as they arise Essential Skills Solid proficiency in MS Word (including Styles and Template development), Excel, and Visio Experience creating complex diagrams and flowcharts in Visio or similar software Exhibits excellent time management skills to effectively organize and prioritize tasks among multiple projects Excellent written and verbal communication skills to connect with cross-functional teams and leadership Ability to work under pressure, meet and prioritize multiple deadlines Work cross-collaboratively with product and engineers to ensure product documentation is technically accurate and aligns with the company’s documentation needs and priorities Preferred Qualifications Technical background in the documentation of system designs, preferably security and/or privacy related Preferred experience in Jira, Confluence, SnagIt, and Cloud PLM (or similar document control system) Familiar with cloud computing services (e.g., Google Cloud Platform) Familiar with both Agile and Waterfall product development methodologies Experience includes technical writing in the healthcare or medical device industry Familiarity with SDLC model, threat modeling, and risk assessments Experience in cybersecurity, technology, privacy, requirements gathering Functional Description Creates, develops, plans, writes and edits operational, instructional, maintenance or test procedures for paper, multimedia, web-based publications and user sites; may produce content for embedded user assistance technology. Conducts interviews with various users and technical staff to gather data for documentation. Researches and translates technical information into manuals and/or web-based documents for nontechnical and technical users. May document engineering processes and specifications. Recommends formats responsive to technical and customer requirements. Produces products that conform to the company documentation and quality assurance standards. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses broad understanding of technical principles and theories. Ability to synthesize external data and research findings for application that may impact technical objectives. Scope Demonstrates successes in technical proficiency and independent thought. Works on complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Exercises judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Position Summary As a member of the Design Verification Team, you will directly influence the successful launch of our next generation of Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems. You will represent the team in the elaboration of the design verification strategy and creation of verification plans while considering the needs of various stakeholders. You will take part in the design and automation of test methods to enable verification activities to scale and match Dexcom’s growth rate. You are expected to develop relationships and use your communication skills to influence and provide constructive feedback in the review of design requirements ensuring they are testable and to enable the verification team to effectively manage the costs of verification activities. You will clearly describe in test protocols: decisions for preconditioning test samples, execution steps, required accuracy and resolution of equipment for the test, test sample configuration, sampling plan based on risk analysis, acceptance criteria and data analysis methodology. You will develop and apply your expertise with the latest industry standards and best engineering practices to develop and validate electromechanical test methods. You will help train technical support staff in the proper execution of test methods. You will confirm failures observed by technical support staff and ensure the proper failure analysis documentation is generated to enable root cause investigations. You will ensure the proper statistical data analysis is used to support the conclusion of test outcomes. You will help defend and justify the verification strategy and results during regulatory submission reviews and audits. Duties And Responsibilities Collaborate with external lab partners for pre-conditioning of test samples and execution of outsourced tests (ex. EMC, Safety, Environmental Stress Tests) Represent the DVT team on project’s V&V Core Teams and provide periodic progress update Develop the verification strategy; create and maintain verification plans Perform Design for Test analysis and provide testability guidelines and recommendations Define sampling plans meeting expectations of the risk management process Define strategies to reduce cost (ex. re-use of test samples, reduction of sample size, etc.) Specify, design, and select measurement and data acquisition systems Define appropriate criteria and activities for test method validations Collaborate with other departments to design scalable test methods and needed fixturing Create and maintain documentation relevant to the verification activities such as procedures, test protocols, test reports, equivalency justifications Conduct peer reviews and approvals of data analysis and test documentation Train technical support staff and ensure failure analysis reports are properly documented to enable investigations with design teams Essential Skills Electrical Engineering degree (or similar degree) from an ABET accredited engineering school Project management / leadership skills Experience with EMC, Radio, Wireless Coexistence Testing methods Demonstrated capability to lead and positively influence technical decisions considering both short-term and long-term impacts Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills. Experience with tools for the design of electro-mechanical systems (ex. PCBA and fixture design) Experienced with the use of common measurement tools (ex. oscilloscope, spectrum analyzers, data acquisition systems) Preferred Qualifications Demonstrated knowledge of test planning and use of basic statistical tools (ex. hypothesis testing, t-test, ANOVA). Knowledge of at least 1 scripting / high level programming language (ex. python, MATLAB, C) Experience in controlling and automating measurement and data acquisition systems through common networking communication interfaces Experience with structured and methodological of test method / design development processes. Travel Required Up to 25% Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 5-8 years related experience or Masters degree and 2-5 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 0-2 years experience. Functional Description Designs, develops, and implements cost-effective methods of testing and troubleshooting systems and equipment for all phases of product development and manufacturing. Prepares test and diagnostic programs, designs test fixtures and equipment, and completes specifications and procedures for new products. Plans the labor, schedules, and equipment required for testing and evaluating standard and special devices. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses broad understanding of technical principles and theories. Ability to synthesize external data and research findings for application that may impact technical objectives. Scope Demonstrates successes in technical proficiency and independent thought. Works on complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Exercises judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Judgement Exercises good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Normally receives little instruction on day-to-day work, general instructions on new assignments. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Summary You will be part of the team that defines, and architects enhanced Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) experience. You will analyze CGM time series data to develop technologies that can rapidly adapt to changing customer and business needs. Work on glucose and relevant time-series data to develop signal processing/filtering methods, algorithms/analytics, statistical models, and simulations for enhancing the utility of CGM systems and quality of life of diabetics. Work as a member of a R&D and technology development team. Collaborate and communicate with other departments including firmware/hardware, sensor/membrane, and mechanical engineering to help design and verify optimal CGM systems. May author clinical reports and external publications and will contribute significantly to Dexcom activities to achieve leadership in improving CGM and its utility. Essential Duties And Responsibilities In depth knowledge of statistical signal processing such as Kalman filter design Fluent in classical signal processing techniques Familiarity with machine learning techniques Use techniques from signal processing, time series, statistical analysis and machine learning to develop new algorithms and enhance the existing ones to improve CGM system performance and accuracy Contribute to research in CGM system to respond to customers and market needs Apply data mining and machine learning techniques to extract valuable information and patterns from the server data Optimize firmware and hardware designs Run simulations and present results to cross-functional teams Generate reports and support publications Develop and execute verification tests Design, develop and validate toolsets for algorithm integration and verification Troubleshoot software design and coding issues Participate in the System Requirement, sub-system requirement and software requirements review effort to ensure that requirements are actionable, measurable and testable Create engineering documentation and design specifications Required Qualifications Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 8-12 years related experience or Master’s degree and 5-7 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 2-4 years of equivalent industry experience. Program in statistical programming languages such as R, MATLAB or Python Good understanding of statistics, analog and digital signal processing techniques Functional Description Builds advanced mathematical models of human physiology/anatomy and its interaction with external systems, such as Dexcom's continuous glucose monitors (CGM). Designs, develops and/or evaluates complex algorithms for use in research/development, clinical applications or end user applications. Uses techniques in machine learning, signal processing and neural networks to develop new products or features and enhance the capabilities of new ones. Develops processes and tools to analyze algorithms and plays a strategic role in designing clinical design, while ensuring the product meets regulatory and marketing requirements and maintaining our leading position in the market. Participates in decision making and project planning activities both within the scope of algorithm development and the overall product pipeline. May contribute to manuscripts and publications detailing product features, enhancements or novel algorithmic approaches to design of medical products. Prepares, reviews and advices the organization on the structure of its patent portfolio. May coordinate the translation of product specification to architecture and design following good SW engineering practices. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses advanced knowledge of technical principles and theories. Recommends solutions in support of functional objectives tied to overall company objectives and strategies. Scope Demonstrates significant technical expertise, collaboration with others and independent thought. Anticipates potential complex problems requiring an in-depth evaluation. Demonstrates strategic thinking and commercial/industry understanding in functional projects. When meaningful & purposeful opportunities occur, our Remote-First teams may gather in-person at hub locations (Pacific Northwest, Pacific Southwest, Midwest and Texas).
