Summary As a member of the operations advanced manufacturing engineering team, this automation engineer will support, analyze, develop, and lead efforts to ensure implementation of robust manufacturing assembly processes related to automation, injection molding, process development, equipment, production fixture design, and general hardware and mechanical engineering processes. This engineer will collaborate with cross functional teams and stakeholders both internal and external to Dexcom and p rovide engineering support for moderate to complex design, development, and implementation assignments. Engineering and operations activities may include planning, developing, designing, tracking, and construction or any other aspect of engineering or operations work. This engineer will collaborate with cross functional teams and stakeholders both internal and external to Dexcom. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Support/lead DFM/DFA activities of mechanical components, sub-assemblies, etc. to contribute to the design and development of new products and resulting high volume assembly processes. Provide technical guidance, as needed, to suppliers to ensure sound engineering or operations practices. Fundamental understanding of materials including thermoplastics, thermosets, etc. Leads/develops designs, performs hands-on testing & analysis, etc. activities for proof-of-concept machine/equipment – includes collaboration with R&D teams. Define and lead automated / semi-automated product assembly equipment, system architecture, robotics concepts, and tooling development efforts with internal and external development teams. Design and implement scalable processes, mechanical tests, production fixtures, inspections and tests to improve product quality and increase productivity or reduce costs. Develops and maintain project timelines and provides updates and feedback to project leadership. Integration of manufacturing principles into R&D designs to ensure robust manufacturing processes - requires regular participation with new product (NPI) R&D teams. Develop test plans, equipment requirements, protocols, and reports to ensure designs meet product and part specifications, regulatory requirements, and applicable standards for new equipment and processes including IQ/OQ/PQ protocols Plan, design, develop, execute, and lead production cost and/or quality improvement projects including all necessary documentation. Drive projects and decisions as required using guidance from cross functional teams and stakeholder requirements. Hands on investigation and testing of current and new product / process issues. Review, update, and support PLC, Vision, HMI, and robot automation systems in high volume 24./7 manufacturing Effectively communicate with broad Dexcom team on project progress and challenges. Accomplishes tasks while conforming to the company quality system procedures. This position assumes and performs other duties as assigned. Additional Duties Would Typically Include Ability to apply engineering design and drafting tools, such as SolidWorks. Analyze field and/or manufacturing failures of mechanical components, sub-assemblies, and instruments, and provide corrective and preventative solutions and actions. Participate as the Operations Mechanical/Systems Engineering representative in departmental and external project teams. Provide engineering support to assembly and test personnel. Understanding of Manufacturing Statistical methods, such as process capability and Design of Experiments. Understands and can apply statistical tools used to assist in development and troubleshooting of products and processes. Project Management leadership in areas focusing on design changes, process improvements, outsourcing, material cost reduction, and other plant efficiency efforts. Summary Under the general direction of the Engineering Manager, the Staff Automation Controls Engineer provides project management and Controls engineering technical support related to manual, semi auto, or more complex high-speed fully automated equipment which are primarily located at External Contract Manufacturing (CM) partner’s clean room facilities. This position is for a hands-on engineer who will collaborate with cross functional teams and stakeholders, both internal and external to Dexcom, and provide engineering support to solve moderate to complex controls related issues, and plans and executes improvement for existing PLC, HMI, Vision, and data collection systems and/or software. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Provide automation, instrumentation and controls engineering services for installed equipment within Dexcom’s contract manufacturing facilities. Scope of work includes activities from design through installation, testing and qualification of equipment. Projects may include new equipment, existing equipment upgrades, capacity expansions, equipment replacement, and investigation and correction of existing issues in order to improve productivity and quality. Create and/or review and approve design specifications, drawings, and other project documents such as URS, FNS, SDS, etc. Develop and execute test plans, and controls related validation protocols. Write reports to document equipment/process meets part/assembly specifications and regulatory requirements. Review and approve vendor provided document package, including but not limited to drawings, manuals, and validation protocols as they relate to equipment controls systems. Perform PLC /HMI/PC/Robot/vision code review and approval. Recommend and/or implement improvements to enhance performance and reliability. Proficient in writing new code or modifying existing PLC/HMI/PC/Vision software to enhance or expand functionality, and reliability. Experience with Allen Bradley PLCs and Cognex vision products is highly desirable. Proficient in writing new or modifying existing data collection software using commercially available data collection and SCADA/HMI packages such as Ignition, Wonderware, and FactoryTalk. Experienced in using connectivity platform such as Kepware. Create and / or update standards as they relate to software HMI screes designs, and PLC/Robot/SCADA codes. Working knowledge of different types of servos systems, sensors and devices is required. Manage assigned project to ensure projects are completed on-time and within budget. Hands on investigation and troubleshooting of manufacturing equipment issues is required. Experience in performing Engineering Studies using DMAIC methodology is highly desired. Provide training and coaching to engineers and technicians on new and existing Software and procedures Proficiency in using Project engineering tools such as Smartsheet, Microsoft Project, Statistical Programs and Microsoft Office suite is required. Ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with company interdepartmental teams including Regulatory, Quality Assurance, R&D and Process Engineering is required. May be assigned other duties by department manager as necessary. Required Qualifications Highly proficient in developing PLC/HMI programs for high-speed automated equipment. Working knowledge of authoring and executing equipment and validation protocols (URS, FNS, SDS, FAT, SAT, IQ, OQ & PQ). Experience in installation, and validation of automated equipment as it related to software and systems Working knowledge of GMP standards and procedures Demonstrated use of analytical tools and procedures used in Lean Six Sigma such as utilizing the DMAIC methodology for continuous improvement. Demonstrated experience in medical device automation, test methods/standards, processes and related equipment. Proficient in using PC/Software including Microsoft Office, Microsoft Project, statistical tools and CAD software. Experience in working in clean room environments. Preferred Qualifications Experience in programing Cognex vision system is highly desired. Experience with multi axis robots is highly desired. Demonstrated project engineering on the commissioning of Automated systems on the factory floor. Strong familiarity with electro-mechanical equipment design and development process Excellent communication (written and verbal) and personal interaction skills. Proven ability to work hands-on in a fast-paced environment. Proven ability to multi-task, prioritize projects, and maintain timelines. Flexibility in a changing environment. Detail oriented and organized. Language Skills: Must be able to communicate effectively in English. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. What You’ll Do** Development and support of the network security infrastructure, including intrusion prevention, malware sandboxing, SSL visibility, endpoint detection & response, and more Support penetration testing activities and their vulnerability management. Be the final point of escalation for incident response activities as assigned. Keep close awareness of cyber security incidents in relative industries and report incidents when applicable through the incident response process. Assess the vulnerabilities present in our environment and determine prioritization and impact to our business on the systems supported by the infrastructure team including but not limited to laptops, Mac books, network and server infrastructure Provide guidance to the team on the remediation of the vulnerabilities as well as coordinate patching and roll out plans. Develop playbooks and automation for the repeatable deployment of system components and performing routine management/deployment tasks. Suggest and implement improvements to our security monitoring tools Work on Security projects to improve the organizations security posture Maintain procedures for the patching process and provide feedback on standards, guidelines, and vulnerability assessment methodology framework Assist in the security assessment of existing and newly proposed tools used by team What We’re Looking For** In-depth understanding of network protocols and operating systems Broad understanding of security vulnerability mitigation solutions at all layers Ability to analyze large data sets to identify trends/anomalies within a SIEM 2-3 years experience of implementing alerts, and onboarding new solutions to Splunk Able to troubleshoot splunk performance issues Awareness of the current threat landscape Experience with Qualys, Microsoft Intune, JAMF, and other vulnerability scanning and remediation utilities a plus Scripting experience in either Python or Powershell or solid SOAR experience Proven track record of mentoring junior team members Excellent verbal and written communications skills Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills with a strong attention to detail Ability to collaborate with personnel at all levels across the organization and to comprehend business imperatives Strong organizational skills; ability to prioritize workload and balance multiple duties and work in a fast-paced environment Skills And Experience Preferably at least 5+ years experience in cybersecurity, including compliance and risk management with a system and network security engineering background. Solid technical and analytical expertise, with a proven deep background (preferred 5+ years’ IT experience in addition to cybersecurity) in technology design, implementation, and delivery. Experience in cloud computing technologies, including software-, infrastructure, and platform-as-a-service, as well as public, private, and hybrid environments. Knowledge of traditional security controls and technologies, such as Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems, intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), public key infrastructure (PKI), identity and access management (IDAM) systems, antivirus and firewalls, in addition to newer offerings such as endpoint detection and response (EDR), threat intelligence platforms, security automation and orchestration, deception technologies and application controls. Skilled in meeting vulnerability and penetration testing requirements. Nice to haves Professional security certification, such as a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), GIAC Certified Web Application Defender (GWEB), or other similar credentials. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported expected full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Position Summary As a key member of the material science group within Dexcom’s research and development organization, the staff scientist is responsible for developing and demonstrating feasibility of novel membrane material designs to support next generation biosensor products. The individual is expected to have clear understanding of the technical and business challenges associated with medical device material component product development and will be responsible for developing, validating, and implementing technical solutions that meet business objectives. In this capacity, the scientist will drive the creation and maintenance of design requirements, develop and reduce concepts to final specification, identify and mitigate risks, interface with external partners and collaborate with internal stake holders to drive the project to completion. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Plan and execute experiments (DOE) supporting novel membrane formulations, characterization, and process development for the prototyping of new biosensing modalities. Independently develop methods and in-process testing for the characterization of coating solutions and membrane with Viscometer/Rheometer, DLS, Zeta potential analyzer, mechanical test, DSC, FT-IR, NMR, etc. Identify, procure, and qualify critical raw materials and manage vendors to support formulation development and commercialization. Partner with development teams to develop formulations, design processes and material solutions with novel functional materials that address formulation challenges and product quality. Develop technical strategy, maintain project timelines, and communicate to other stakeholders. Partner with design teams to develop and test new sensor prototypes. Work cross-functionally with R&D, manufacturing, QA, clinical / regulatory, legal / IP, and other internal stakeholders to align on design requirements and ensure technical, clinical, and commercial feasibility. Identify, procure, install, and qualify new equipment and processes for characterizing formulation stability and characterizing process. Develop procedures, plans, protocols and reports to ensure designs and processes meet product specifications, regulatory requirements and standards Work with vendors to assess supply, controls, cost, and acceptance criteria. Maintain accurate and up-to-date lab records and notebooks Understand and apply basic laboratory safety protocols, chemical hygiene, and dispose chemical waste according to company and local EHS regulations Other duties as assigned Required Qualifications Demonstrated knowledge and experience of polymer solution physics and formulation engineering for biocompatibility, functionality, and manufacturability Experience with immobilizing functional molecules onto polymers and characterization of immobilization efficiency Experience with experimental design, assay development, statistics, DOE techniques, data analysis methods and software (JMP preferred) Strong analytical and experimental skills for organic polymer and polymer solution characterization (Viscometer/Rheometer, Mechanical test(Instron), DLS, Zeta potential analyzer, DSC, FT-IR, NMR) Highly organized and detailed oriented. Excellent communication (written and verbal), collaboration, and interpersonal skills. Excellent work ethic, ability to deal with ambiguity/uncertainty, and willingness to learn. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. provides continuous glucose monitoring technology to help patients and their clinicians better manage diabetes. Since our inception, we have focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions for people with diabetes - while empowering our community to take control of diabetes. Position Summary As a member of the IT Core Services Team, the OKTA Systems Administrator will be responsible for the configuration, planning, deployment, and administration of a large OKTA environment. This position is primarily focused in administering and enhancing the OKTA SaaS identity platform while also providing support for the administration of an enterprise Active Directory environment. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Conduct enterprise-level administration, customization, and maintenance of a large OKTA environment. Includes the support for SSO/MFA integration with new applications (Cloud and On Prem). Manage application provisioning and application lifecycle management using OKTA. Configure and maintain custom rules, workflows, scripting, and automation processes within the OKTA platform to create efficiencies for the organization. Provide production support for OKTA and troubleshoot issues and system outages. Function as the OKTA Technical Authority and Subject Matter Expert within the organization. Assist teams and application owners in migrating authentication to OKTA, including requirements gathering, configuration, and testing. Manage the integration between OKTA and on-prem Active Directory, Azure AD and ServiceNow. Perform enterprise-level Active Directory administration. Includes Forest/Domain Architecture, DNS infrastructure, Active Directory sites, Group Policies, Certificate Services, PowerShell scripting and monitoring of AD replication. Execute systems administration tasks for Microsoft Windows Infrastructure. Includes server administration, installation of operating systems, updating firmware and BIOS, installing latest security patches, and maintaining proactive monitoring. Analyze, evaluate, and/or provide recommendations for improvement in the efficiency of internal processes, and IT operations. Follow proper Change Management and Change Control processes. Creates and maintains standards on documentation related to identity processes, procedures, and infrastructure. Designs and maintains flowchart diagrams and process workflows. Performs capacity planning, architects system upgrades and prepares for future expansion of the OKTA platform. Required Qualifications Bachelor’s technical degree from a four-year college or university is preferred and/or minimum of 8 years’ experience with IT systems administration. At least 5 years of experience administering, customizing, and maintaining a large OKTA environment. “OKTA Certified Administrator” credential is Required Minimum of 4 years of experience administering a large enterprise Active Directory environment. Strong knowledge in security standards and protocols such as LDAP, SAML, OpenID, SSO/MFA, RADIUS, Kerberos, Federation Services, RBAC, OAuth, OIDC, SOAP, JSON, REST is required Experience with implementing OKTA Access Gateway to manage authentication for on-prem applications Experience with deploying OKTA SCIM Connectors for application provisioning/deprovisioning Experience with the integration of OKTA with Active Directory and the installation/configuration and monitoring of AD Sync Agents. Experience with integrating OKTA with Cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud/Apps, MS Azure is desired Experience with integrating OKTA with ServiceNow. Some ServiceNow Administration experience would be desired. Strong experience in analyzing logs and identifying problems with authentication and authorization Other desired certifications: MCSE (Windows Server 2012/2016/2019), MCITP Experience with other IAM/IGA platforms, such as SailPoint is Desired. Some experience with administering Microsoft Office365 and Azure AD platforms is desired. Experience using JIRA and following the Agile/Scrum methodologies Customer service skills and excellent communication skills (verbal, presentation, and written). Functional Description Defines, designs and administers network systems used for data communications and recommends improvements necessary to ensure operation of the company's high traffic, business critical internet production environment. Responsible for making sure that the company network always works. Manages the load configuration of a central data communication processor and makes recommendations for purchase or upgrade of data networks. Proposes and implements network system enhancements (software and hardware updates) that will improve the performance and reliability of the network system. Applies capacity planning to business recommendations. First point of contact for performance analysis, scalability and service architecture/database administration issues. May be asked to coordinate equipment orders including terminals and cable installation, as well as upgrading, monitoring, testing and servicing the database/systems. Approves action requests and specifies purchase requirement. Negotiates and places orders with common carriers. Functional/Business Knowledge Having wide-ranging experience and uses professional concepts and knowledge of company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways. Possesses knowledge of advanced concepts, techniques, and standards. Viewed as expert in the field within the Function. Scope Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation. Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives. Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise. Judgement Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignment. Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other colleagues. Management N/A Field Sales N/A Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree and a minimum of 8-12 years of related experience. At this level a graduate degree may be desirable with 4 years of related experience. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 6,000 people worldwide. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Responsible for improvement, optimization, and implementation of manufacturing process/assembly steps and operating procedures for replicate equipment and processes within a regulated quality system. Lead equipment/process qualifications including protocol development and execution. Develop and maintain project timelines and provide updates and feedback to project leadership. Effectively implement problem solving skills and techniques to identify potential process risks, assess their impact developing and implementing mitigation plans. Plan and perform Design of Experiments (DOE) and utilize six sigma methodologies to characterize, assess capabilities, and determine optimal processing operating windows. Consult with vendors to produce equipment, materials, and/or parts that meet determined product specifications Perform statistically robust and industry standard analysis of data, and present findings to technical teams Exercise judgment within defined procedures and policies to determine appropriate action. Transferring process knowledge and understanding to receiving site operations teams along with providing technical training for responsible processes. Assist in the development of project timelines and provide technical updates and feedback to project leadership Consult with AME Process Engineering in scaling up equipment and processes from prototype to pilot to full scale manufacturing This position assumes and performs other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications Typically requires a Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Bioengineering, Chemical Engineering, Materials Science or equivalent with 8+ years related experience, preferred or a masters in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Bioengineering or equivalent with 3+ years related experience. Ability to run self-directed projects, maintain timelines, stay organized, and balance multiple activities in a fast-paced environment Ability to deal with ambiguity/uncertainty and a willingness to try new/challenging things. Proven ability to work hands-on in a fast-paced environment. Experience with factorial experimental design, data analysis, and interpretation of experiments; JMP experience, Statgraphics or Minitab preferred Excellent communication (written and verbal) and personal interaction skills Knowledge of high reliability, high volume manufacturing processes and designs. Preferred Qualifications Medical device experience Lean Six Sigma or Six Sigma training and certification preferred Deep understanding of formal DOE methodologies and techniques Experience in qualifying/validating equipment & processes for use in the medical industry highly desired. Functional Description Provides technical and sustaining engineering support in a manufacturing area. Recommends and implements equipment and process modifications to improve production efficiencies, manufacturing techniques and production yields for existing products. Develops and conducts statistical analysis such as Design of Experiments (DOE) and Statistical Process Control (SPC) targeting physical cause of failure for yield loss and improving quality. Interacts with product design and development personnel to ensure that processes and designs are compatible. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses advanced knowledge of technical principles and theories. Recommends solutions in support of functional objectives tied to overall company objectives and strategies. Scope Demonstrates significant technical expertise, collaboration with others and independent thought. Anticipates potential complex problems requiring an in-depth evaluation. Demonstrates strategic thinking and commercial/industry understanding in functional projects. Judgement Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other colleagues. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 8-12 years related experience or Masters degree and 5-7 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 2-4 years of experience. Workplace Type The Workplace Type for this role is Assigned Desk. Based on the nature of your role you will have an assigned desk or office located at a Dexcom site and should plan to be onsite approximately 4-5 days per week. highest priority topics and drive alignment across stakeholders on key program decisions: Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to align on messaging and framing of critical decisions / questions Drive content creation for readouts to SW R&D leadership Support Dexcom’s commercial priorities by bridging the gap between engineering and commercial teams, and developing actionable roadmaps for key features Required Qualifications Technical Proficient in Powerpoint and Excel Experience with qualitative and quantitative analyses (e.g., financial modelling, data analysis, budget management etc.) Experience working with Jira and Agile Ways of Working preferred Non-technical Self-starter with ability to drive analyses and initiatives independently Strong communication skills to drive alignment across stakeholders Experience working in fast-paced environments Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities simultaneously Track record of creative problem-solving driven by strong business sense Ability to manage complexity while driving clarity Ability to ramp up on new topics quickly Preferred Qualifications Medical Technology MBA preferred. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Product Security Cybersecurity Technical Programs is part of the R&D organization in Product Security, and is responsible for the developer training program. The role will reduce risk to our company by ensuring our developers Design, Code, and Test using Secure SDLC approaches. By educating everyone involved in the software development process including developers, architects, managers, testers, business owners, and partners, you reduce the chances that the organization will become a victim of today’s security threats and attacks and ensure that our team can properly build defensible applications from the start. Duties And Responsibilities Develop the training program, and evolve it based on changes to the threat landscape Create program materials and deliver training using commonly accepted secure development practices and techniques Build relationships with devops teams and management to promote secure coding and best practices Educate on common design flaws to build products with security protection in mind, proactively mitigating threats at the beginning of the design cycle Promote the adoption of secure application development across the organization Understand the developer roles and experience levels, and provide training tools for junior and seasoned developers on advanced topics and application exploitation Understand threat currency and tailor training and materials to address the changing landscape Track training and report on training efficacy, saturation and results Essential Skills Experience with secure application development standards such as OWASP (Top 10, ASVS, API Security, Mobile Top 10) Experience in cybersecurity, technology, or privacy Experience with devsecops, or application security Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills are critical. Excellent presentation skills are essential to program success. Preferred Qualifications Prior experience with security training Prior exposure to developer training tools such as Secure Code Warrior, Gitlab, etc Understanding of developing in a regulated environment and adhering to a quality management system Functional Description Manages the development and implementation process of a company's products and services. Oversees multiple interconnected, complex projects, coordinates departmental or cross-functional teams, and focused on delivering new or upgrading existing products. Monitors the program from initiation through commercialization including planning and directing schedules and monitoring budget/spending to ensure successful program outcomes. May develop, define and execute project plans, identify resources, define and assign major roles, and interface with external customers or field-based employees on technical matters, as needed. Functional/Business Knowledge Possesses advanced knowledge of technical principles and theories. Recommends solutions in support of functional objectives tied to overall company objectives and strategies. Scope Demonstrates significant technical expertise, collaboration with others and independent thought. Anticipates potential complex problems requiring an in-depth evaluation. Demonstrates strategic thinking and commercial/industry understanding in functional projects. Judgement Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other colleagues. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 8-12 years related experience or Masters degree and 5-7 years equivalent industry experience or a PhD and 2-4 years of experience. jobTitle: Supervisor Manufacturing - 5am - 5pm, Sun - Every Other Wed
jobDescription: About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Responsible for executing to agreed upon production plan and yields within their area of production. Oversees training and complete training records for all manufacturing personnel. Regularly monitors the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of manufacturing processes. May act as the back up to the Manufacturing Manager as required. Supervises the maintenance of personnel records and timesheets for staff. Supports the manufacturing lines to solve issues related with manufacturing processes, equipment, materials, etc. Develops schedules and manpower requirements for assigned areas. Acts as liaison between manufacturing, R&D, and engineering to get engineering requests processed correctly and in a timely manner. Accountable for assisting with the efficient, safe and cost-effective operation of the department; for advising and making recommendations to the Manufacturing Manager with respect to these activities. Coordinates with various groups such as quality and engineering to analyze product failure data and test results in order to determine causes of problems and develop solutions. Other duties may be assigned. Functional Description Directs the development and implementation of activities in production area(s) to meet production goals, quality, and cost objectives. Prioritizes production schedules based on product introduction, equipment efficiency, and materials supply. Plans and administers procedures and budgets. Makes budgetary recommendations and at higher levels, controls capital expenditures and direct/indirect labor. Develops schedules and manpower requirements for assigned areas. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Functional/Business Knowledge Strong knowledge of technical and functional principles and ability to teach others. Understands company mission and strategies. Scope Receives assignments in the form of objectives with goals and the process by which to meet goals. Provides direction to others according to established policies and management guidance. Administers company policies that directly affect team members / supporting employees. Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Networks with senior internal and external colleagues in own area of expertise. Judgement Works on issues where analysis of situation or data requires review of relevant factors. Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve results will cause delays in schedules / work products. Management Provides direct supervision to individual contributors and/or support individual contributors/matrix reports. Acts as advisor to unit or sub/units and may become actively involved, as required, to meet schedules and resolve problems. People management responsibilities include hiring / terminations, performance reviews, career development coaching and compensation decisions. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree with 5-8 years of industry experience. Informal management/ team lead experience. jobTitle: Supervisor Manufacturing - 5pm - 5am, Sun - Tues, Every Other Sat
jobDescription: Summary Leads a cleanroom manufacturing department and drives team towards adhering to departmental metrics, objectives and initiatives. Allocates resources, addresses manufacturing line down scenarios, and works closely with support functional teams (i.e. Product Focus Team, Calibration, Manufacturing Equipment Support, etc.). Ensures a safe work place and drives proactive safety improvements. Conducts and utilizes problem solving techniques to identify root causes to processes, incoming material or personnel related issues and develops and implements sustainable countermeasures to address them. Takes a proactive approach to continuous improvement initiatives by analyzing existing processes and applying lean manufacturing techniques and concepts in order to improve production efficiencies, throughput and quality. Assists with the transfer of new product introduction and prepares the manufacturing line, training of personnel and 5S prior to product launch. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Responsible for executing to the agreed upon production plan and meeting budgeted yields within the area of responsibility. Drives team towards meeting daily, monthly and yearly departmental metrics, goals and objectives. Ensures a safe working environment for the team and drives proactive safety improvements. Regularly monitors the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of manufacturing processes. Supports the manufacturing lines to solve issues related with the manufacturing processes, equipment, materials, etc. Coordinates with various groups such as quality and engineering to analyze product failure data and test results in order to determine causes of problems and develop solutions. Assembles and analyzes pareto charts for yield failure modes and creates and drives action plans in order to address yield loss. Obtains and evaluates process timings in order to balance and level load manufacturing operators. Applies lean manufacturing techniques and concepts to assembly line processes in order to improve efficiencies, throughput and quality. Identifies and eliminates various wastes within manufacturing processes. Drives 5S tool within area of responsibility. Ensures accountability and discipline within the team and communicates personnel related issues immediately to manager. Reviews and evaluates capacity models and anticipates when new equipment or additional headcount will be required. Works cohesively with cross-functional teams in order to drive continuous improvement projects, solve problems and meet departmental goals. Demonstrates initiative by seeking out new projects that can positively impact the organization by reducing scrap, increasing gross margins and improving productivity. Analyzes and plans work force utilization, space requirements, and work flow. Designs layouts to place new equipment and workspace for maximum efficiency. Generates and maintains project timelines and provides updates and feedback to manager. Reviews assembly process instructions and makes updates to incorporate standard work and improve repeatability. Assists with the transfer of new products into manufacturing. Assists with the generation of Bill of Materials, assembly procedures and other documentation prior to product launch. Oversees training and ensures all training records for manufacturing personnel are always up to date. Ensures that the team follows manufacturing documentation and addresses compliance related issues. Develops schedules and manpower requirement for assigned areas. Accountable for assisting with the efficient, safe and cost-effective operation of the department; for advising and making recommendations to the Manufacturing Manager with respect to these activities. Supervises the maintenance of personnel records and timesheets for responsible staff. Interview, hire and cross-train personnel. Provide regular positive and constructive feedback and evaluate/appraise employee performance yearly. Completes assigned tasks or projects within the agreed upon dates assigned. Performs other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work cohesively within a team environment. Highly adaptable to change. Preferred Qualifications Bachelors degree with 5-8 years experience of industry experience Lean manufacturing education and practical hands on experience. About Dexcom Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2021 revenues of $2.48B, a growth of 27% over 2020. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 7,000 people worldwide. Functional Description Directs the development and implementation of activities in production area(s) to meet production goals, quality, and cost objectives. Prioritizes production schedules based on product introduction, equipment efficiency, and materials supply. Plans and administers procedures and budgets. Makes budgetary recommendations and at higher levels, controls capital expenditures and direct/indirect labor. Develops schedules and manpower requirements for assigned areas. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Functional/Business Knowledge Strong knowledge of technical and functional principles and ability to teach others. Understands company mission and strategies. Scope Receives assignments in the form of objectives with goals and the process by which to meet goals. Provides direction to others according to established policies and management guidance. Administers company policies that directly affect team members / supporting employees. Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Networks with senior internal and external colleagues in own area of expertise. Judgement Works on issues where analysis of situation or data requires review of relevant factors. Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve results will cause delays in schedules / work products. Management Provides direct supervision to individual contributors and/or support individual contributors/matrix reports. Acts as advisor to unit or sub/units and may become actively involved, as required, to meet schedules and resolve problems. People management responsibilities include hiring / terminations, performance reviews, career development coaching and compensation decisions. Experience And Education Typically requires a Bachelors degree with 5-8 years of industry experience. Informal management/ team lead experience.
